info.name: Clock PMS+ API Docs
info.description:
Welcome to Clock PMS+ API request/responce center.

The Clock API can give you a notification of certain events like booking creation, folio closing, etc. Notifications can be received through two methods: HTTP/S Push (Clock server makes a POST to a URL on your server) or Long Pooling (Your server listens on a URL on our server).

**Useful links**

- [Developers Center](https://developers.clock-software.com/)
    
- [Product updates](https://support.clock-software.com/support/solutions/9000116110).
    
- [Message Channels (PUSH, SQS..)](https://api-docs.clock-software.com/#message-channels-webhooks).
    

---

**Ready to start?**

\=> If you want to become our partner and you are already familiar with the documentation or need a test (sandbox) account, please visit our [Developer portal](https://developers.clock-software.com/support/solutions/folders/9000197841).

---

# Authentication

To access the API, you need an 'api_user' and 'api_key' using the 'Digest access authentication' method.

_API credentials example:_

- API User: dummyapi
    
- API Secret key: 9e76358201fab9389db70ff16h3bb688
    
- Example Base API Url: sky-eu1.clock-software.com/base_api/11111/22222
    

_Terminology:_

- sky-eu1 – Subscription region.
    
- base_api – The selected API type.
    
- 11111 – The customer subscription number.
    
- 22222 – The customer account number.
    

Note: Subscription ID and Account ID it can be found also as :subscription_id and :account_id abbreviations in our docs.

---

# Using parameters for data filtering

All URLs support parameter passing for filtering the result. Searching by 'Equal' (eq), 'Not equal'  
(not_eq), 'Greater' (gt), 'Greater and equal' (gteq), 'Less' (lt), 'Less and equal' (lteq), and similar  
operators are supported. For the full list of operators check this article :  
[https://www.rubydoc.info/github/rails/rails/Arel/Predications](https://www.rubydoc.info/github/rails/rails/Arel/Predications)

---

### Before using special characters for filtering you need to encode them first

Example: If you need to find the bookings with reference number #123 you need to use:

```
bookings?reference_number=#123(# is the encoded #)

 ```

instead of

```
bookings?reference_number=#123

 ```

[Here](https://www.w3schools.com/tags/ref_urlencode.ASP) more information about URL encoding

---

Searching for an empty and NIL value is also supported.

Examples:

1. Searching for folios closed after a certain date-time using 'Greater or Equal' operator:  
    **base_api/:subscription_id/:account_id/folios?closed_at.gteq=2014-12-30T06:34:58.623Z** Or ( any time zone )  
    **base_api/:subscription_id/:account_id/folios?closed_at.gteq=22014-12-30T06:34:58.623+02:00**
    
2. Searching for folios with ID greater than 123:  
    **base_api/:subscription_id/:account_id/folios?id.gt=123**
    
3. Searching for folios in a list of invoice numbers “456, 457, 458”:  
    **base_api/:subscription_id/:account_id/folios?invoice_number\[\]=456&invoice_number\[\]=457&invoice_number\[\]=458**
    
4. Searching for Open (close_date is NIL), Valid (voided_at is NIL) folios  
    **base_api/:subscription_id/:account_id/folios?close_date.eq&voided_at.eq**
    
5. Search for DoorKeys requested for deletion (deleted_at is NIL and delete_requested_at is NOT NIL)  
    **pms_api/:subscription_id/:account_id/door_keys?deleted_at.eq&delete_requested_at.not_eq**
    
6. Search for Room Type WBE Rates ( wbe is True and bookable_type is “Pms::RoomType”)  
    **/pms_api/:subscription_id/:account_id/rates?wbe.eq=true&bookable_type.eq=Pms::RoomType**
    
7. Search for bookings using guests details(all guests)  
    **/pms_api/:subscription_id/:account_id/bookings?main_guest_free_text_search=Smith**
    

**!! Only attributes at the first object level can be used for filtering.**

---

# API rate limit

The rate limit is **5 calls** per second per API user. An 'HTTP/ 429 Too Many Requests' error will be returned, when this limit is exceeded\*.

**\*If the limit is exceeded it is advisable to retry the requests which resulted in 'HTTP/ 429 Too Many Requests' with exponential backoff and max number of retries as the example bellow:**

delay = retry counter \* 500 milliseconds

1-st response 'HTTP/ 429 Too Many Requests'  
set retry counter = 1  
delay = 500 milliseconds

2-nd response 'HTTP/ 429 Too Many Requests'  
set retry counter = 2  
delay = 1000 milliseconds

...

N-th response 'HTTP/ 429 Too Many Requests'  
set retry counter = N  
delay = N\*500 milliseconds

---

**Please note:**

- **Other client errors (4xx, 5xx) indicate that you need to revise the request to correct the problem before trying again. Please do not retry them automatically**
    
- **To optimize the API usega please don't extract the full list of objects. Use the filter parameters to only get the data that you need. Thank you for your cooperation.**
    

---

# Web Aplicaiton Firewall (WAF)

The WAF analyses each request to Clock PMS+ servers in order to identify threats and every suspicious behavior is considered as such!

WAF banns every suspicious caller (IP) for 2 hours. If you are banned, please check your server logs for 403 HTTP errors. To avoid future bans you should carefully analyse your workflows and service behavior which led to error 403 and fix it to prevent them from reoccurring.

---

# Message channels (Webhooks)

With the Message Channels in the Clock API, you can get instant notifications of selected events. Three notification methods are used: **Pull**, **PUSH** and **SQS**.  
Please note that SQS message service is on-demand and they are not activated by default.  
If you want to activate it, please get in touch with the Support team at Clock Software and provide your account details.

- **PULL**
    

The 'Long polling' method is used.

“Long polling is itself is not a true push; the long polling is a variation of the traditional polling technique, but it allows you to emulate a push mechanism when a real push is not possible, e.g.: sites with security policies that require the rejection of incoming HTTP/S Requests. With long polling, the client requests information from the server exactly as in normal polling, except it issues its HTTP/S requests (polls) at a much slower frequency. If the server does not have any information available for the client when the poll is received, instead of sending an empty response, the server holds the request open and waits for response information to become available. Once it does, the server immediately sends an HTTP/S response to the client, completing the open HTTP/S Request. In this way, the usual response latency (the time between when the information first becomes available and the next client request) otherwise associated with polling clients is eliminated.” - Wikipedia.  
If no messages are available, 304 http code will be returned in 30 seconds. In case of event – http code 200 will be returned.  
When the Message Channel is used, the 'Check-After-Job' techniques implementation is strongly recommended: After finishing with the tasks related with the received event, check for new events through the REST methods.  
Example: If you get a 'Folio Closed' event and export it to the accounting software, after the export itself check for newly closed folios using Folios Get URL.  
The Actual Event URL can be found by calling the Root URL.

- **PUSH**
    

HTTP or HTTPS POST will be submitted to аn URL on your server.

The HTTP/S Push notification also has a retry feature (<u>max 3 retries with 20 seconds delay</u>) in case your URL is not reachable at the moment.

A separate URL is required for each account (hotel/restaurant). To this end, a parameter, subdomain or domain for each account URL can be used. Example URL: [https://push.myhotel.com?account=123](https://push.myhotel.com?account=123)

[Make sure your endpoint is ready to process Amazon SNS messages](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sns/latest/dg/SendMessageToHttp.prepare.html)

**Please Note: Only one webhook is supported per API user per account!**

_Optionally the PUSH notifications may use Basic authentication for accessing your URL. If you want to have Basic authentication, you need to include the username and password in the endpoint URL as the bellow example:_

[https://user:pass@ednpoint.com](https://user:pass@ednpoint.com)

The Push service uses the Amazon SNS service ([more info](https://aws.amazon.com/sns/?whats-new-cards.sort-by=item.additionalFields.postDateTime&whats-new-cards.sort-order=desc)). The POST request payload body contains an AWS SNS notification structure (json). An SNS notification contains:

- Subject – it describes the event type. Example: “folio_close", "booking_new", etc.
    
- Message – the message is in a json-formatted string and contains the ID of the object: booking_id, folio_id, etc. Example: "Message" : "{"booking_id":999999}"
    

_With the object ID, you can get object details using the base/pms API_

**Setup of the push events**

**Pre-requirements:**

1. An URL for each account (hotel/restaurant) on your server.
    
2. Administrative access to the your Web server logs. You should be able to view POST payload body.
    

Setup

1. You: Please use the [webhook create](https://api-docs.clock-software.com/#ee2ca591-aa14-40e9-89ca-52cbec2904b0) endpoint .
    
2. You: Check your Web server log, find the confirmation POST request. In the payload body, find the 'SubscribeURL' parameter. (an example of the request is located in the Appendix to this document).
    
3. You: Paste the 'SubscribeURL' in your browser and confirm the request.
    
4. You: Test the event notifications by creating a test booking.
    

**Keep in mind that for the initial confirmation your server logs need to be turned on and to include the full context of the payload.**

- **SQS**
    

Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS).

[Read more about Amazon SQS](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSSimpleQueueService/latest/SQSDeveloperGuide/welcome.html).

**HTTP/S Push – URL Confirmation**


**HTTP/S Push – Event Message Example (booking_new)**

```
POST / HTTP/1.1x-amz-sns-message-type: Notificationx-amz-sns-message-id: 22b80b92-fdea-4c2c-8f9d-bdfb0c7bf324x-amz-sns-topic-arn: arn:aws:sns:us-west-2:123456789012:MyTopicx-amz-sns-subscription-arn: arn:aws:sns:us-west-2:123456789012:MyTopic:c9135db0-26c4-47ec-8998-413945fb5a96Content-Length: 773Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8Host: example.comConnection: Keep-AliveUser-Agent: Amazon Simple Notification Service Agent{ "Type" : "Notification", "MessageId" : "22b80b92-fdea-4c2c-8f9d-bdfb0c7bf324",
"TopicArn" : "arn:aws:sns:us-west-2:123456789012:MyTopic","Subject" : "booking_new","Message" : "{\"booking_id\":693926}", "Timestamp" : "2015-11-17T09:44:23.421Z", "SignatureVersion" : "1", "Signature" : "", "SigningCertURL" : "https://sns.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/SimpleNotificationService-bb750dd426d95ee9390147a5624348ee.pem", "UnsubscribeURL" : "https://sns.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/?Action=Unsubscribe&SubscriptionArn=arn:aws:sns:eu-west-1:006467213368:PUSH_Ro_Test:fc851d44-40ec-40d5-88fc-acccfc7b5250"}

 ```

---

# Data formats and standards

| Type | Value |
| --- | --- |
| _DateTime_ | In JSON and XML, datetime is in an ISO 8601 format (with a time zone): "2001-12-30T06:34:58.623Z” or "2001-12-30T08:34:58.623+02:00”. In YAML, a 'space separated' UTC only format is used : “2001-12-30 06:34:58.6236040 Z”. All datetimes contain a time zone, so they can be converted to any other time zone without data being lost. |
| _Date_ | A date is rendered in an ISO 8601 format: '2001-12-30'. All dates are converted from the datetime of an event to the accoount time zone and then time is stripped. Example: If a folio is closed on 31 Dec 2001 at 22:00 UTC and your time zone is +3, the folio date of closing will be 01 Jan 2002. |
| _String_ | Up to 256 characters |
| _Text_ | No size limitation |
| _Decimal_ | Precision is set for each attribute. _Example: 15,4_ |
| _Integer_ | Large-range integer : -9223372036854775808 to 9223372036854775807 |
| _Boolean_ | 'true' / 'false' |
| _'_cents' fields_ | All money field values are presented in sub-units in an integer format. Divide the value by 100 to get the currency unit value . Example: price_cents: 9091; currency: EUR is 90.91 EUR. There are several exceptions where 1 unit is not equal to 100 sub-units: BHD, CLF, IQD, JPY, KWD, LYD, MGA, MRO, OMR, TND, VND, VUV. In these cases, use their specific sub-unit ratio. |
| _'_currency' fields_ | All currency fields are ISO 4217, three-letter codes. |
| _Country fields_ | Country fields are ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 (two-letter country code). |

item.name: (POS) Transfer charges to booking / company / event folio
1. GOOD PRACTICES

request.description:
All available services are configured in Clock PMS as charge templates. The **charge_templates** endpoint exposes the complete list of charge templates and they can be filtered for convenience. 
For revenue segmentation purposes you will need to allow the users to select which charge template/s should be used when the charges are created from your system in Clock PMS. It is very important to have the chare created with the all parameters configured in the charge template. Quite often there are custom fields created for the charge templates where important accounting information is stored, such as account number, profit center, etc and the charge should be created with the configured values so they will be properly transferred to the accounting software latter on.
The mapping may be designed according the customers need as bellow:
- All charges are using one charge template
- Each item group is using a separate charge template
- Each item is using a separate charge_templates

**IMPORTANT: Store the mapped charge_template_id and use it latter on for charge creation (2.3. Booking - charge create, 3.2. Company - charge create, 4.2. Event - charge create, 5.2. End of day (EOD) revenue transfer)**

*Please note that you can use different value for "text" filed of the charge in order to make the charge more clear for the customer (example: Back massage, Fish SPA, etc instead of SPA services)

request.description: Occasionally the transfer charges have to be voided or refunded. When that is necessary we advise you to handle the void / refund by transferring charge with positive price and negative qty matching the void / refund. This approach will work perfectly even if the folio to which the charges were transferred is closed.

item.description: The following hints will help you to design the interface in way which will ensure its efficiency and usability for the users.

item.name: 2. CHARGE BOOKING

query.description: Search by guest name, phone or e-mail address*
The parameters are alternative (OR) ones, when combined the response will contain all checd_in bookings matchin some of the parameters!!!

request.description:
*Find **checked_in** bookings with period including **today's** date.*
Using:

- **Room** - Specify the room name/number to find the bookings checked in into them;
- **Guest name, phone or e-mail address** - Please note you can search only by the name, phone, e-mail of the main guest of the booking;
- **Identity tag** - Identity tags may be added to the bookings for easier booking identification. However, the identity tags are optional.

**Please note the response may contain more than one bookings and you would let the user to select which one to use!**

If additional booking details are required for precise guests identification you can use bookings endpoint in order to fetch them using the id of the booking

request.description: *Use the charge - BULK CREATE endpoint to create all charges at once with the details you already have in the charge template mapping* Please use **"charge_template_id"** from the created mapping (1.1. Charge template mappings) in your request together with the **"service_date"**. However, the parameters configured in the charge template can still be overridden. For example, if **"text": "Test charge"** is included, it will override the **"text"** value configured in the charge template. **Please note:** If some of the required parameters for charge creation are not configured in the used charge template, an error will be returned. The required parameters are: - **"revenue_group"** - **"price"** - **"text"** ***PLEASE NOTE:* charge - BULK CREATE endpoint supports up to 100 charges to be created at once if you need to create more than 100 charges you will need to separate them in different calls. If you try to create more than 100 charges you will receive** ``` "error": "Charges exceeds the limit!" ```

item.description: Transfer charges (restaurant or other extra services) to the room folio is a frequently used and demanded feature by the hotel guests which established it as a standard.

item.name: 3. CHARGE COMPANY

request.description:
Use chargeable_folios_companies endpoint to get the list of all chargeable company folios in Clock PMS. The folios should be created for the company in advance and should be open and valid. The companies should accept charges(boolean field accept_charge_transfers = true). Using parameter accept_charge_transfers_only=false you can also get all folios metching the search even if company's parameter accept_charge_transfers=false

Please note it is very likely to have more than one company folio matching your search criteria and the user shall select the right one!

response.name: 3.1. Company search

request.description: --- **Please note a folio shouldn't contain more than 5000 charges** --- *Use the folio_id of the selected folio from 3.1. with the charge - BULK CREATE endpoint to create all charges at once with the details you already have in the charge template mapping* Please use **"charge_template_id"** from the created mapping (1.1. Charge template mappings) in your request together with the **"service_date"**. However, the parameters configured in the charge template can still be overridden. For example, if **"text": "Test charge"** is included, it will override the **"text"** value configured in the charge template. **Please note:** If some of the required parameters for charge creation are not configured in the used charge template, an error will be returned. The required parameters are: - **"revenue_group"** - **"price"** - **"text"** ***PLEASE NOTE:* charge - BULK CREATE endpoint supports up to 100 charges to be created at once if you need to create more than 100 charges you will need to separate them in different calls. If you try to create more than 100 charges you will receive** ``` "error": "Charges exceeds the limit!" ```

item.description: Transfer charges to a company folio is highly demanded and it is highly advisable to be added to your interface.

item.name: 4. CHARGE EVENT

query.key: Atleast one of the bellow parameters is required

request.description:
Use chargeable_folios_events endpoint to get the list the folios which can be charged for the events created in Clock PMS matching your search criteria. 

Please note it is very likely to have more than one event folio matching your search criteria and the user shall select the right one!

**Company parameter Accept charge transfers control:**
The optional parameter **accept_charge_transfers_only** will check the Accept charge transfers parameter state of the company the event is associated with. - accept_charge_transfers_only=false - will return the folios for all events regardless of Accept charge transfers parameter configuration - **Default behavior of the endpoint**

accept_charge_transfers_only=true - will return only the folios for events associated with companies with Accept charge transfers parameter set to true.

request.description: --- **Please note a folio shouldn't contain more than 5000 charges** --- *Use the folio_id of the folio created with 5.1 and charge - BULK CREATE endpoint to create all charges at once with the details you already have in the charge template mapping* Please use **"charge_template_id"** from the created mapping (1.1. Charge template mappings) in your request together with the **"service_date"**. However, the parameters configured in the charge template can still be overridden. For example, if **"text": "Test charge"** is included, it will override the **"text"** value configured in the charge template. **Please note:** If some of the required parameters for charge creation are not configured in the used charge template, an error will be returned. The required parameters are: - **"revenue_group"** - **"price"** - **"text"** ***PLEASE NOTE:* charge - BULK CREATE endpoint supports up to 100 charges to be created at once if you need to create more than 100 charges you will need to separate them in different calls. If you try to create more than 100 charges you will receive** ``` "error": "Charges exceeds the limit!" ``` ***TO AVOID REVENUE DUPLICATIONS* the charges already transferred to booking, company or event folio should be excluded! In order not to exceed the API calls limit it is recommended do the end of day revenue transfer when the financial day is over and no ongoing transfers are expected!**
Use the ID of the folio created with 5.1 and  folio_credit_items endpoint in order to transfer the payments received against those charges.

request.description: _Close the EOD transfer folio._ Once you are ready transferring revenue and payments for the given date, close the folio created with 5.1. Using it's ID! The API user needs the right “Folio: Close” granted. Additionally the right “Folio: Close folio with outstanding balance” may be granted depending on business needs. Optional parameter “document_type_id” can be passed to close folio as invoice. However document close is a fiscalisation event and if fiscalization service is used, “document_type_id” must be used of a document type configured **NOT TO BE FISCALIZED** to avoid **DOUBLE FISCALISATION!** !!! Please note this step is very important for the usability of the interface and shouldn't be skipped !!!

item.name: How to Embed Clock PMS Payment Enablement Service in Third-Party Booking Engine Checkout Workflows
1. Embed Drop-in script and stylesheet into the check-out page

request.description:
We recommend that you implement [Subresource Integrity (SRI)](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Security/Subresource_Integrity) to ensure that the files you are loading from Adyen have not been manipulated or tampered with by malicious actors.

To use the SRI hash, you need to add an `integrity` attribute when specifying or  elements. Browsers will also check for the `crossorigin` attribute to ensure that the origin allows [Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS)](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/CORS). If a browser detects that the file's hash does not match the specified hash, the browser will not load the resource. To know which browsers support SRI, refer to this [browser compatibility list](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Security/Subresource_Integrity#Browser_compatibility).

item.name: 2. Create a DOM element for Drop-in

request.description:
Create a DOM container element on your checkout page where you want Drop-in to be rendered and give it a descriptive id. We strongly recommend that you don't put it in an iframe element, because it may cause issues.

If you are using JavaScript frameworks such as Vue or React, make sure that you use references instead of selectors and that you don't re-render the DOM element.

Your server should call the designated endpoint of the Clock PMS API to create the payment session details required for Drop-in initialization.
When the session is created pass the details from the API response to your [check-out page](https://api-docs.clock-software.com/#dde85bb5-ef6f-4013-9495-d52a4a57f305)!

- **"return_url"** in the request is required as it will be used is a redirect is required during the tokenisation process for 3DS.

- You need to store the value of **"credit_card_id"** form the response. credit_card_id will hold the created token and you will need it once the booking is created to associate the tokenized card with the booking.

item.name: 4. Fetch Session Details and Initialize Drop-in

body.raw:
<script type="module">
        // Custom messages mapping
        const messages = {
            "Refused": "The payment was refused. Please check your payment details and try again. If the issue persists, contact your bank.",
            "Error": "There was an error processing your payment. Please try again later.",
            "Cancelled": "The payment was cancelled. Please try again."
        };

        // Function to initialize the Adyen Drop-in
        async function initializeAdyenCheckout() {
            try {
                // Initialize the Adyen Drop-in
                const checkout = await AdyenCheckout({
                    environment: "env value" // Replace with your env
                    clientKey: "client_key value", // Replace with your client_key
                    session: "session_data value" // Replace with your session_data
                    },
                    paymentMethodsConfiguration: {
                        card: {
                            hasHolderName: false, // Set to 'true' if holder name should be requested
                            holderNameRequired: false, // Set to 'true' if holder name should be required
                            billingAddressRequired: false, // Set to 'true' if address should be required
                            billingAddressMode: 'full', // 'full' to collect the full address, 'partial' for only postal code
                        }
                    },
                    onPaymentCompleted: (result, component) => {
                        console.info('Payment completed:', result, component);

                        if (result.resultCode === "Authorised") {
                            // Display a success message within the Drop-in component
                            component.setStatus('success');
                        } else {
                            // Handle different result codes by displaying messages within the Drop-in
                            const message = messages[result.resultCode] || messages.Error;
                            component.setStatus('error', { message });
                        }
                    },
                });

                checkout.create('dropin').mount('#dropin-container');
            } catch (error) {
                console.error('Failed to initialize Adyen Drop-in:', error);
            }
        }

        // Initialize the Adyen Drop-in
        initializeAdyenCheckout();
    </script>

Use the standard [booking_credit_cards - CREATE](https://api-docs.clock-software.com/#5c98293b-8a79-449f-b92b-a0d1efd70bb8) endpoint to assign the created token to the booking you just created. You will need the following parameters to do so:
- The **"booking_id"** of the newly created booking with step [7. Create booking](https://api-docs.clock-software.com/#f48762f7-75d9-4b1c-bf82-65c092a8cd59). 
- **"credit_card_id"** received with the API response in step [3. Create payment session](https://api-docs.clock-software.com/#ac1900ad-7128-4789-935d-a946af115e02).

If your booking guarantee policy requires not only tokenisation of the credit card but also a payment use the standard [booking_credit_cards - CHARGE](https://api-docs.clock-software.com/#b2477f51-40e7-471a-b6ad-b2e378c089c0) endpoint to do so.
You will need the following parameters do so:
- The **"booking_id"** of the booking the token is associated with, step [8. Assign created token to the booking](https://api-docs.clock-software.com/#c72f6a0e-d561-4db1-bbef-ba11b958f17b). 
- **"credit_card_id"** received with the API response in step [3. Create payment session](https://api-docs.clock-software.com/#ac1900ad-7128-4789-935d-a946af115e02).

item.description:
This guide is designed to help developers which are aiming to integrate Clock PMS Payment Enablement Service into their custom Booking Engines. The process is quite straight forward and involves the below steps:

**Important note:** _The integration process uses combined elements from the infrastructure of Clock PMS and Adyen in a specific way. Please follow only this guide and not Adyen's technical documentation!_
***

item.name: Accounting data syncronisation
Additional Activities

request.description: The activities may be asosciated with booking and event and hence they are started from one of those. From the Activities section select **Edit Activities** to access the fully fledged Activities Screen. From the Activities screen you can create new activity by selecting one of the options at the left (The names as defined in the [Activity provider configuration](https://api-docs.clock-software.com/#dc6f952c-c6de-4b3a-a467-71b02e41a22f)). When an option is selected the user will be forwarded to your system to lead the booking process in an iFrame. Please note the URL may include additional parameters like activity_uuid as described in [Activity provider configuration](https://api-docs.clock-software.com/#dc6f952c-c6de-4b3a-a467-71b02e41a22f) so you can identify which activity to [update ](https://api-docs.clock-software.com/#adddc3c6-422a-42fb-a2e7-e66d7f9b9403) after the process is over. Example update request: ``` json { "activity": { "start_time": "2024-08-28T10:00:00.000+03:00", "end_time": "2024-08-23T11:00:00.000+03:00", "description": "Stone massage with Alice", "reference_id": "SPA.119" } } ``` The information you updated the activity will apear in the activity line in the activity section of the boking / event. If the process fails the activity should be udapted as failed as descrivbed [here.](https://api-docs.clock-software.com/#adddc3c6-422a-42fb-a2e7-e66d7f9b9403) You can also charge the booking / event with the cost of the additional activity or keep the charges at your end untill the activity is completed and than decide if it will be paid on spot or the charges will be transfered to Clock PMS+. In both cases please follow our [charges transfer guide.](https://api-docs.clock-software.com/#71b3d681-0df9-414f-923a-3749bdb8386c)

As everything related to the guest stay is a subject of a change and the activities are not an exception. From the Activities screen the existign actiities may be updated. When an option is selected the user will be forwarded to your system to lead the udpated process in an iFrame. Please note the URL may include additional parameters like activity_uuid as described in [Activity provider configuration](https://api-docs.clock-software.com/#dc6f952c-c6de-4b3a-a467-71b02e41a22f) so you can preload some of the details of the activity as well as to identify which activity to [update ](https://api-docs.clock-software.com/#adddc3c6-422a-42fb-a2e7-e66d7f9b9403) after the process is over. **Please note: If udpate is not supoprted in the given situation or at all you can simply communicate by displaying the proper message in the iFrame** Example update request: ``` json { "activity": { "start_time": "2024-08-28T14:00:00.000+03:00", "end_time": "2024-08-23T15:00:00.000+03:00", "description": "Stone massage with Alice", "reference_id": "SPA.119" } } ``` The information you updated the activity will apear in the activity line in the activity section of the boking / event. If you deal with the charges they can be adjusted following our [charges transfer guide.](https://api-docs.clock-software.com/#71b3d681-0df9-414f-923a-3749bdb8386c)

From the Activities screen the existign actiities may be canceled. When an option is selected the user will be forwarded to your system to lead the cancelation process in an iFrame. Please note the URL may include additional parameters like activity_uuid as described in [Activity provider configuration](https://api-docs.clock-software.com/#dc6f952c-c6de-4b3a-a467-71b02e41a22f) so you can preload some of the details of the activity as well as to identify which activity to [update ](https://api-docs.clock-software.com/#adddc3c6-422a-42fb-a2e7-e66d7f9b9403) after the process is over. **Please note: If cancel is not supoprted in the given situation or at all you can simply communicate by displaying the proper message in the iFrame** Example update request: ``` json { "activity": { "start_time": "2024-08-28T14:00:00.000+03:00", "end_time": "2024-08-23T15:00:00.000+03:00", "description": "Stone massage with Alice", "reference_id": "SPA.119", "cancel_reference_id": "CANCEL_SPA.119" } } ``` The apearance of the activity change after the cancelation in the activity section of the boking / event. The colourign of the record is more grey as well as the update and cancell buttons are not active anymore. If you deal with the charges they can be adjusted following our [charges transfer guide.](https://api-docs.clock-software.com/#71b3d681-0df9-414f-923a-3749bdb8386c)

item.description: A hotel stay is more than just a room; it’s a comprehensive experience. Additional activities often represent significant revenue streams for hotels and must be well-organized. These activities typically involve planning, scheduling, and booking resources at specific times, making them key milestones in the guest’s daily schedule. Our API is designed to seamlessly integrate additional activity vendors directly with hotel bookings and events. These activities, often offered by third-party vendors, are not directly related to the room stay but greatly enhance the overall guest experience. Examples include: - SPA treatments - Guided tours of local attractions - Restaurant reservations The activity infrastructure allows activity vendors to link their services to hotel bookings and MICE (Meetings, Incentives, Conferences, and Exhibitions) events, providing guests with a convenient and enriched stay through diverse and personalized experiences. The activity is at first created in Clock PMS+. Than the booking process is handled by the provider in an iFrame. At the end the final status of the activity is updated via the API. The following scenarious are currently suported: - [Create new actuivity](https://api-docs.clock-software.com/#db6e9b67-9481-46ea-ae00-200fba6cf497)**;** - [Update of an existing activity](https://api-docs.clock-software.com/#074d80b6-ac39-4aba-b721-8d0d1a373ee2)**;** - [Cancel existing activity](https://api-docs.clock-software.com/#2bb03f36-a700-444f-8406-e866af8caced)**.** ## How does the entire process looks like? Steps of the process: 1. **USER**: Selects the “Edit Activity” button in the Activities section of the Booking / Event. There selects one of the available Activity options on the left(Specific names are configured for every provider); 2. **Clock PMS**: The Clock PMS+ Opens the defined URL + parameters for the provider in an Iframe; 3. **Activity Provider**: Fetches the activity details via the API (using activity_uuid) and guides the user in the process; 4. **USER**: Makes the necessary selections and completes the activity booking process; 5. **Activity Provider**: Updates the activity with the process outcome 6. **USER** : Can can tstart update / cancel processes which may be handles the same way as new activity. The following guide will help you easily integrate your system with Clock PMS+ activities:

item.description:
*The guide describes how you can use the standard* ***ClockPMS+*** *credit card and payment infrastructure together with your custom build web reservation system (WRS).* * * * > **PLEASE NOTE:** > > The customer's server receives the already encrypted block and therefore it is not necessary to undergo a PCI DSS audit. > > **However you still need to complete a self-assessment questionnaire (SAQ A-EP) on annual basis**. > The higher class SAQ-D can be also used in case you have already completed it! > > You can find the SAQ A-EP in the PCI's document library: > > [https://www.pcisecuritystandards.org/docume>nt_library](https://www.pcisecuritystandards.org/docume>nt_library) > > For more info on the Javascript method, please visit: > [https://www.pcisecuritystandards.org/pdfs/b>est_practices_securing_ecommerce.pdf](https://www.pcisecuritystandards.org/pdfs/b>est_practices_securing_ecommerce.pdf) * * * Via the **credit_cards** endpoint, customers can add (tokenize) credit cards to the system. Credit cards, however, have to have client-side encryption. To enable client-side encryption of credit cards, we have prepared special javascript to be generated for each account. The javascript can be added on the customer's credit card page. Here are the details: * The hotel wants to create their own WRS, in which guests can enter their credit cards details. But what the same doesn't want is to undergo a PCI DSS audit or make their own payment interfaces. * The customer creates a credit card collection page (it has to be https) by adding special tags (data-encrypted-name) to the form fields. * Takes the path to the specially generated JS library from **Settings - Credit Card - Client-Side Encryption** for API integrations * Places the library in the form for credit cards in the WRS. **Example:** ``` ``` * The guest enters their CC details in the already-mentioned form. * ClockPMS+ client side encryption library encrypts the data in one block which is sent to the customer's server. * With this method the encrypted block MUST NOT be saved. * Instead, the encrypted block is sent to ClockPMS+ server and a Token is returned using the **credit_card_token** endpoint (example:credit_card_token - CREATE). If the Token is needed at a later stage, it can be saved (to charge the token and guarantee the booking for example). * Bookings are created and the above Token can be added to them using **booking_credit_cards** endpoint (booking_credit_cards - CREATE). * You can add some charges the already tokenized card using **charge_token** endpoint (booking_credit_cards - CHARGE) * Sample of customer's forms **HTML** can be found bellow: ```
CSV, CVC2, CVV2, CID, etc.
``` *It takes a token, i.e. a credit card has been already added and the token is available to be added to the booking.* You have to know the token which already have been added to the booking, so that the booking can be charged. It takes a value and returns execution flag complete: true, as well as payment_service – the service used for making the payment (it is automatically selected among the available active services)*

item.description:
[Here ](https://api-docs.clock-software.com/#message-channels-webhooks) you can find more information about the PUSH/Webhooks.

You are able to activate/deactivate or check the current status of the PUSH/Webhooks directly through the API.

Kindly note that only one webhook is supported per API user.

If you need to change the URL, you will need to submit a delete request. The delete request can be done at least 48 hours after the webhook was created and confirmed.

request.description:
*Update folio fiscalization details.*

fiscal_request_code – free text field ( no length limitations ). Printed on the bottom of the folio. The label of the field can be customized by the user in Clock PMS settings.

fiscal_response_code – free text field ( no length limitations ). Printed on the bottom of the folio. The label of the field can be customized by the user in Clock PMS settings. If this field is not null, the folio is considered as fiscalized by the system. The setting “Wait for folio fiscalization before printing” in Clock PMS/POS, depends on this field also.

Note: If fiscal QR is necessary, it can be used qr_code_text field from the folios endpoint.

    "version": "1.0",

}

item.description:
Based on Clock PMS/POS API you can build a fiscal interface to comply with the local fiscal requirements.

You can use the notificaiton suported by Clock PMS APi and monitor for folio_close even top trigger the fiscalization. In the event notification you will receive the ID of the closed folio so you can call back the API and fetch all the data which you need. Along with the other fields the folio supports 2 dedicated fields for local fiscal requirements (fiscalization). The fields are dedicated for integration with fiscal interfaces.

request.description: _The KID number is generated automatically during the folio close process. You can fetch the KID number using the id of the closed folio._

request.description:
_Closing a folio action._  
The API user needs the right “Folio: Close” granted. Additionally the right “Folio: Close folio with outstanding balance” may be granted depending on business needs. Optional parameter “document_type_id” can be passed to close folio as invoice. The possible document_type_ids may be fetched using [document_types - VIEW](https://api-docs.clock-software.com/#ab384c3e-94c2-488b-9f5a-b16fa65a1551) endpoint.

Using this endpoint you can initiate a payment transaction on a payment terminal. Please note the transaction should be completed on the specified payment terminal. The list of available terminals may be found useing [payment_terminals](https://api-docs.clock-software.com/#dde5a8e0-5093-47c1-9bdb-12adde9d30a6) endpoint. The sucesfull (200) respose will contain a transaction_id which you can use to chekc the transaction status with [credit_card_transaction - GET](https://api-docs.clock-software.com/#e7b217f9-68f5-482f-8cab-a12593e148bc) endpoint.

response.name: folio_close

item.description:
**Important:** Folios are the main financial objects in Clock. They are used for recording charges, credit items (payments) and calculating taxes (VAT, etc.).

**Folio status:** the folio can be 'open' or 'closed'

- **Open folios :** folio attributes and charges can be changed. An open folio can be considered
to be an active customer account or open bill. **'close_date' is nil**.
- **Closed folio :** folio attributes and charges cannot be changed. Closed folios can be
considered to be issued documents, an invoice or closed bill. **'close_date' is not nil**.

**Validity status:** a folio can be 'voided' or 'valid'


- **Voided folios :** invalidated folios by users. Usually these folios are issued by mistake and
therefore voided. **'voided_at' is not nil**.



- **Valid folios : 'voided_at' is nil**.

request.description:
*Get a specific charge from a folio.*

**Please note:** "discount_rate" will have a value only for the discount charges created using the standard discount functionality of Clock PMS+ and null for all other charges

request.description:
---

**IMPORTANT NOTICE:** A folio is limited to a maximum of **15,000 charges**. Once this limit is reached, the folio will be automatically **blocked** and will not accept any further charges.

---

When the **"charge_template_id"** is included in the request, the charge will be created using the charge template with the given ID. Only the **"service_date"** for the charge needs to be added to the request. However, the parameters configured in the charge template can still be overridden. For example, if **"text": "Test charge"** is included, it will override the **"text"** value configured in the charge template.

**Please note:** If some of the required parameters for charge creation are not configured in the used charge template, an error will be returned. The required parameters are:

- **"revenue_group"**
    
- **"price"**
    
- **"text"**
    

---

_Create multiple(up to 100) charges guest bill with a single call. The charges will either be successful (code 200) or will fail with the respective error code and description_

_**PLEASE NOTE:**_ **the endpoint supports up to 100 charges to be created at once if you need to create more than 100 charges you will need to separate them in different calls. If you try to create more than 100 charges you will receive**

```
  "error": "Charges exceeds the limit!"

 ```

request.description: *Voiding charge from folio.*

item.description:
*Charges (Services, Products, etc.) related to a Folio. Charges represent the CURRENT state of attributes for a posted service/product. Previous versions (changes) of charges are not present in the Charges object. Find the full history of charge in the 'Charge Log' object.Use the POST method with the same URL to create a new charge.*



 - The right **'Charges: Create'** should be granted to the API user. 
 - Upon the successful charge creation, the new charge itself will be retuned. Otherwise the error
  code 500 and its description will be returned.  
 - The Folio 'Closed Status' should be 'Open' and 'Validity status' should be 'Valid', so that charges can be accepted,


**Modifiers (for each charge record)**
Each charge can contain several 'modifiers'. Modifiers are elements INCUDED in the charge price.
Examples:Modifiers in PMS can be the City Tax included in the price but not posted as a separate
charge. Modifiers in POS can be a 'Extra cheese' price add-on to a 'Pizza' product.
Often modifiers can have purely a 'Descriptive' meaning and no price. As in POS: 'Medium beaked'
used as a steak descriptor.

request.description: The endpoint exposes all folios to which you can create charges (valid, open non-deposit folios) for the companies which are accepting charges (accept_charge_transfers=true). Using parameter accept_charge_transfers_only=false you can also get all folios metching the search even if company's parameter accept_charge_transfers=false

response.name: chargeable_folios_companies - VIEW

item.description: List of companies registered.The basic company contact info is located in the 'contact_info' object. The Billing info information for invoicing purposes is located in the 'billing_info' object

item.name: Operation Log

request.description: _Charge log for a specific revenue date._ Every charge modification is presented as a separate entry. The connection between the separate entries is established using _master_id_ and _version_. The latest version of the charge has _master_id = null_ and the highest version number. All previous versions have _master_id_ set to the ID of the latest charge, as shown in the example below: | id | text | service_date | master_id | archived_at | created_at | updated_at | price_cents | currency | revenue_group | tax_rate | net_value_cents | tax_value_cents | gross_value_cents | version | revenue_date | | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | | 896089961 | Coffee | 2021-08-16 | 382270889 | June 27, 2024, 11:53 | 2024-06-27, 11:53 | 2024-06-27, 11:53 | 300 | EUR | f&b | 0.2 | \-29500 | \-5900 | \-35400 | 2 | 2024-06-27 | | 896089960 | Coffee | 2021-08-16 | 382270889 | June 27, 2024, 11:53 | 2024-06-27, 11:53 | 2024-06-27, 11:53 | 300 | EUR | f&b | 0.2 | 29500 | 5900 | 35400 | 1 | 2022-11-02 | | 382270889 | Coffee | 2021-08-16 | null | | 2022-11-02, 13:45 | 2024-06-27, 11:53 | 310 | EUR | f&b | 0.2 | 30483 | 6097 | 36580 | 3 | 2024-06-27 | Please check " How does the Clock PMS revenue system work ".

item.description:
The Operation log objects represent all the changes to a charge or payment in an incremental chronology. All charge or payment reports in Clock are based on the charge/payment log.

Logs are accessible for a certain revenue date.

| --- | --- |
| PMS | rooms, f&b, extra, other, tax, packages, deposit,surcharge, surcharge_transfer |
| POS | food, beverage, service, other, discount,surcharge, surcharge_transfer |

request.description:
Payment types in Clock PMS+ are fixed and are as follows:

*   cash,
*   card,
*   bank,
*   debit,
*   on-line,
*   check,
*   vaucher,
*   other,
*   transfer,
*   cross_account_transfer,
*   tip,
*   barter

    

The payment sub-types on the other hand a user configurable and provide additional level of payment segmentation and you can access the full list of configured payment sub-types using the endpoint.
Access a particular payment sub-type

Cashier or Day (POS) closures performed. To get the data between two closures: find created_at for each closure and use as a filter for folios, charge_log or credit_item_log.

*Example:*
```
?created_at.gt=2020-10-17T12:16:37Z**
```

request.description: Use this endpoint to store an Adyen tokenized credit card for future is to Clock PMS+. The Adyen token is an identification of a credit card you have previously stored by using Adyen's API. **Required parameters:** * **pspReference** * **shopperReference** * **recurringDetailReference** For **pspReference** you need to use Adyen's pspReference received with the tokenization transaction. For **shopperReference** and **recurringDetailReference** you can apply two different approaches according to how you are creating the tokens: 1. Set a unique value for **"shopperReference"** for every transaction. **SecureRandom or other UUID generator** can be used for creating the unique **"shopperReference”**. In this case you can use value **LATEST** as **"recurringDetailReference"** for every transaction; 2. Set **"shopperReference"** which is not unique for every transaction such as customer's e-mail address. In this case you must to use a valid **"recurringDetailReference"** received by Adyen for the tokenized transaction. More information about Adyen API for Tokenization (Recurring Payments): Here . For Adyen test account, contact Adyen support. More information about [Adyen setup](https://support.clock-software.com/en/support/solutions/articles/9000213239-adyen-v2). The **credit_card_id** returned in the response should be stored with a Clock PMS+ booking using [booking_credit_cards](https://api-docs.clock-software.com/#5c98293b-8a79-449f-b92b-a0d1efd70bb8) endpoint. The tokens saved with the booking may be then charged if necessary.

item.description:
The Clock Base API is a REST API for access to accounting / financial information in cloud based products: Clock PMS+ and Clock POS. Additionally, there is an API for creating new charges and payments in folios and methods of Custom Payment Service implementation. ## Tax Methods Each account has its own default tax method. The tax method is persisted in each folio.
Support article: [Tax settings](https://support.clock-software.com/en/support/solutions/articles/9000178053-tax-settings)

The tax method can be one of the following: - **no_tax** - No tax calculation - **in_prices_on_row** - Tax included in prices, rounding - per line - **in_prices_on_total** - Tax included in prices, rounding - total - **add_on_row** - Tax not included in prices, rounding - per line - **add_on_total** - Tax not included in prices, rounding – total

request.description:
_Create a booking._

**Status:** The Booking status can be: 'expected', 'checked_in', 'checked_out', 'canceled' or 'no_show'. Bookings having the last two statuses ('canceled' or 'no_show') are considered not to be valid bookings. Such bookings are not taken into availability. The status is fully reversible and can be changed at any time (examples: from 'cancelled' to 'expected'; from 'checked_out' to 'checked_in', etc.)

**Notes:** In order to add a note to the booking use the following parameters in POST/PUT methods: booking\[note\], booking\[housekeeping_note\], booking\[meals_note\], booking\[client_request\]

Please note that all related fields as related_id, arrival_room_type_id, arrival_room_id, main_booking_guest etc are relevant to the object (booking).

Most of the fields are option but mandatory fields are:  
arrival, departure, arrival_room_type_id and guest_e_email or main_booking_guest.

**Creating a booking for a returning guest** If you wish to create a booking associated with existing guest profile instead of creating a new one you need to have the guest id and include it in the booking creation request outside of the booking array like the example bellow:

```
{
"booking": {
        "arrival": "2020-08-08",
        "departure": "2020-08-09",
                 ......    
            },
    "main_booking_guest": "existing guest ID"
}

 ```

request.description:
*Update booking.*

**Status:** The Booking status can be: 'expected', 'checked_in', 'checked_out', 'canceled' or 'no_show'. Bookings  having the last two statuses ('canceled' or 'no_show') are considered  not to be valid bookings. Such bookings are not taken into availability. The status is fully reversible and can be changed at any time (examples: from 'cancelled' to 'expected'; from 'checked_out' to 'checked_in', etc.)

**Notes:** In order to add a note to the booking use the following parameters in POST/PUT methods: booking[note], booking[housekeeping_note], booking[meals_note], booking[client_request] 

**Concurrent booking updates** The API has the **optional** capabilities to handle concurrent updates and inform you in case of conflicts.

If you want to use the option include the field **lock_version** with the current value in your update requests. If the bookings was updated by user/other service in the meantime you will receive the following response:

```
HTTP 500 

{
  "error": "Attempted to update a stale object: Booking"
}
```

If you don't want to use version control just exclude **lock_version** form your booking update requests.

---

Please note that all related fields as related_id, arrival_room_type_id, arrival_room_id etc are relevant to the object (booking).

request.description: **Please note: Due to a complete Adyen integration redesign this endpoint is reaching its end of life. Use the new one Adyen V2 token import instead** Use this endpoint to add an Adyen tokenized credit card to a Booking. The Adyen token is an identification of a credit card previously stored in the Adyen Payment Gateway by you. When you store the credit card you need to set a **unique value for "shopperReference"**. **SecureRandom or other UUID generator** can be used for creating the unique “shopperReference”. The identification consists of two parameters: “shopperReference” (Clock param: “token”) and “shopperEmail” (Clock param: “email”). More information about Adyen API for Tokenization (Recurring contract): Here . For Adyen test account, contact Adyen support. *Required parameters: token; email* More information about Adyen setup.
*Array of booking offer IDs.* More information about booking offers in Clock PMS.
*Array of booking offer IDs.* More information about booking offers in Clock PMS+.

request.description:
Specify the amount which you want to charge the credit card with.
The credit card will be charged via the activated payment provide in ClockPMS+.

Please note the transaction processing is **asynchronous** and you will need to check its status using [credit_card_transactions](https://api-docs.clock-software.com/#e7b217f9-68f5-482f-8cab-a12593e148bc) endpoint. Use **transaction_id** from the response as **cc_transaction_id**

request.description:
*The Room Status Request is used by Clock PMS+ to display a list of free room numbers for a period. The free room numbers are used for the room allocation process (allocating room numbers to bookings). Prior to the room number allocation, the Booking has a room type only (e.g. “Double”).  After the allocation, the Booking is linked to a room number ( 101 / Double, for example). A room is available, if there are no bookings for the period and its status is OK and not OOS (Out Of Service) or Disabled (Not active).*

Request for: **From, To**. Please note, it is not about Arrival and Departure dates. The request refers to the dates of nights in interest (including both From and To dates). **Room Type** (optional).

Result: For each **Room Type** / For each **Room**:

- id: Integer. ID of the Room.
- number: String. Number/Name of the room (example: '101')
- available: Boolean. true – The Room is free/available for allocation. False – The Room is
occupied, OOS or disabled.
- housekeeping_status: String. Empty status means – Clean. Check Room attributes list for
more information.
- housekeeping_warning: String. Free text for hotel/staff usage. Not to be displayed to the
guests/clients.

request.description:
All capacity adjustment days set. Optional: accepts the “date” parameter for query filtering. The Response can be in xml, json or yaml.
Example Request (adjustments between 1 Aug 2020 and 1 Sep 2020)

Updates Availability Adjustment. Multiple lines can be passed. Each line can be for 'date' or period ('from' and 'to').
HTTP code **200** will be returned in case of success. Otherwise, the error code **500** and the error description will be returned.

request.description:
### This request consumes a highest amount of application resources. Please use it with caution. The Rate and Availability Request is used by Clock PMS+ to display free rooms and prices for a selected period. The Calendar in the WRS is based on this request.
Request for : **Period, Selected Rates, Selected Rooms or Room Types**
**Please note:** To have the price properly calculated for the per guest and guest offset rates you will need to use the optional parameters **adults**, **children** and **children_ages**!
Result: For each Room or Room Type / For each Rate / For each Date:
- free: Boolean. General conclusion about the availability, the price and the restrictions. - price: cents (integer) and currency. Calculated price if any. - room_type_free_rooms: Integer. How many free rooms for related room type has. - errors: Explanation about restriction validations. - rate_restriction: All restrictions set for this rate/date. Restrictions are: - min_adults – Integer - min_children – Integer - max_adults – Integer - max_children – Integer - min_stay – Integer - max_stay – Integer - min_stay_on_arrival - Integer - max_stay_on_arrival - Integer - min_free_rooms – Integer - max_free_rooms – Integer - close_for_arrival – Boolean - close_for_departure – Boolean - stop_from_sale – Boolean - min_days_before_arrival – Integer - max_days_before_arrival – Integer - active_from_date – Date - active_to_date - Date - last_minute_days - Integer - guarantee_policy_id - Integer

response.name: rates_availability - VIEW

request.description:
*Get a list of folios associated with the events matching the search criteria (name,period, check-in status). Once you have the folio ID you can access it using folios endpoint*


The optional parameter **accept_charge_transfers_only** will check the Accept charge transfers parameter state of the company the event is associated with. - accept_charge_transfers_only=false - will return the folios for all events regardless of Accept charge transfers parameter configuration - **Default behavior of the endpoint**
- accept_charge_transfers_only=true - will return only the folios for events associated with companies with Accept charge transfers parameter set to true.

request.description:
The Block Pickups endpoint is used to display room type (including virtual room types, if any) total blocks day-by-day for the selected period as well as the block pickup and the remaining blocks. The same object is used by the “Block Pickup Report” in Clock PMS+.

**Result**: For each Event, Block, Room Type, and each Date, you can get:

*   room_count. The total number of blocked rooms.
*   remaining_pickups. The remaining blocked rooms.
*   bookings_count. Picked-up (booked) rooms number.
*   composite_status. Combination of the statuses of the block (if Optional) and the event(Optional, Allotment, Non-Guaranteed, Guaranteed). The combination may look like the following:  
    Optional block in a Guaranteed event - "Optional in Guaranteed";  
    Optional block in a Non-Guaranteed event - "Optional in Non-Guaranteed";  
    Optional block in an Optional event - "Optional"
*   extended. Details about the Event and Block such as Company details, the Event name, Room type and rate, adults, and children specified in the block.

response.name: block_pickups - VIEW (Default)
block_pickups - VIEW(report_type=pickup)

request.description:
The Block Prices endpoint is used to display the revenue forecast of the blocked rooms day-by-day* for the selected period. The prices are calculated based on the selected rate or defined manual price for the block and is ***recalculated once per day hence the changes will affect the result on the next day***.

**Result**: For each Event, Block, Room Type, and each Date, combination the total block net and gross values will be returned. Additionally a revenue groups net and gross price breakdown is added so the necessary ones may be used.

'* The dates without calculated prices will not be returned in the response.

response.name: block_prices - VIEW

item.description: With the Clock Door Key API, hotels can connect a custom door key system to Clock PMS+. Using this API and the native door key system API, the hotel can develop its own software “adapter” (interface) between the two systems.

request.description:
_View an activity with all its details. Please note that an activity can be associated with either a hotel booking or an event, but not both simultaneously!_

The **"status"** may have the following values:  
\- **"pending"** - First status when created  
\- **"call_gateway"** - When GENERIC provider is used and the cusotmer is redirected in an iFrame  
\- **"success"** - When the provider udpates the activity with atleast **"start_time",** **"end_time"** and **"reference_id"** the status is automatically set to **"success"**  
\- **"failure"** - When the activity is not sucesfully completed with the provider the reason / error should be updated in **"failure_message"** and that will automatically change the status of the activity to **"failure"**

response.name: activity - VIEW

request.description:
_Update the activity with the outcome of operation. The following operations are posisble:_

- _**New activity and update of an existing one:**_
    
    - _**Sucess -**_ _when the booking is completed sucesfuly update the follwing atributes of the activity:_
        
        - **"start_time"** - **required,**
            
        - **"end_time"** - **required,**
            
        - **"description"** - _optional,_
            
        - **"reference_id"** - **required,**
            
    - _**Failure -**_ _if the booking is not sucesfull you need to set_ **"failure_message"**
        
- _**Cancell of activity**_. _When a activity cancellation is trigered and cancelled set_ _**"cancel_reference_id"**_ _and Clock PMS+ will consider the activity as canelled._

item.description:
A hotel stay is more than just a room; it’s a comprehensive experience. Our API is designed to connect additional activity vendors directly with hotel bookings, providing seamless integration of various services. These activities, often offered by third-party vendors, are not directly related to the room stay but significantly enhance the overall guest experience. Examples include:

- SPA treatments
    
- Guided tours of local attractions
    
- Restaurant reservations
    

Using our API, activity vendors can link their services to hotel bookings, offering guests a convenient and enriched stay by incorporating diverse and personalized experiences.

request.description:
*This request consumes a high amount of application resources.*

Please use it with caution.The Occupancy Forecast is used to display the room type (including virtual room types if any) availability day-by-day for the selected period. The same object is used by “Occupancy Forecast” screen in Clock PMS.

*Request:* **Period** (length of the period is restricted to maximum of 365 days)

*Result:* For each **Room Type** and each **Date**, you can get:

*   **capacity**. Physical rooms in hotel.
*   **adjustment**. Manually added or subtracted rooms to/from capacity.
*   **room_statuses**. Rooms not available due to diferent statuses such as Out Of Service (OOS), Out Of Inventory(OOI), etc.
*   **bookings**. Rooms occupied by Bookings.
*   **blocks**. Rooms blocked for events.
*   **constraint.** Parameter of the **virtual room types** showing the number of rooms not available due to bookings for the physical rooms forming the virtual one.
*   **free**. Free rooms = Capacity -/+ Adjustment – OOS – Bookings – Blocks.
    

*Calculated* ***total*** *for each date:*

*   **total_occupied**. Occupied rooms for all room types.
*   **total_free**. Free rooms for all room types
*   **total_occupied_percentage**. Percentage of occupation.
*   **total_adjustment**. Sum of all adjustments.
*   **total_room_statuses"**. All rooms not available due to different statuses.
*   **total_bookings**. Total rooms occupied by bookings.
*   **total_blocks**. All blocked rooms for the day included in the availability.
*   **total_capacity**. Total number of rooms in he hotel.
*   **total_occupied_with_virtual**. Occupied rooms for all room types including virtual.
*   **total_free_with_virtual**. Free rooms for all room types including virtual.

request.description:
### This request consumes a highest amount of application resources. Please use it with caution. The Rate and Availability Request is used by Clock PMS+ to display free rooms and prices for a selected period. The Calendar in the WRS is based on this request.
Request for : **Period, Selected Rates, Selected Rooms or Room Types**
**Please note:** To have the price properly calculated for the per guest and guest offset rates you will need to use the optional parameters **adults**, **children** and **children_ages**!
Result: For each Room or Room Type / For each Rate / For each Date:
- free: Boolean. General conclusion about the availability, the price and the restrictions. - price: cents (integer) and currency. Calculated price if any. - room_type_free_rooms: Integer. How many free rooms for related room type has. - errors: Explanation about restriction validations. - rate_restriction: All restrictions set for this rate/date. Restrictions are: - min_adults – Integer - min_children – Integer - max_adults – Integer - max_children – Integer - min_stay – Integer - max_stay – Integer - min_stay_on_arrival - Integer - max_stay_on_arrival - Integer - min_free_rooms – Integer - max_free_rooms – Integer - close_for_arrival – Boolean - close_for_departure – Boolean - stop_from_sale – Boolean - min_days_before_arrival – Integer - max_days_before_arrival – Integer - active_from_date – Date - active_to_date - Date - last_minute_days - Integer - guarantee_policy_id - Integer

request.description:
*Get the booking engine configurations from Clock PMS+.*
- **wbe_days_advance** - The number of days after which bookings are accepted. '0' means bookings are accepted for the same date and later, '1' means bookings are accepted from tomorrow onwards, etc.
- **wbe_fixed_stays** - Fixed lenght of stay permited. No restrictions if empty.
- **wbe_days_advance_latest_hour** - Latest hour to receive bookings on the first available day for bookings. Works in combination with wbe_days_advance. Example: If 'wbe_days_advance': 0 and 'wbe_days_advance_latest_hour': 19:00 - this means that you can receive bookings for today, but no later than 19:00. After 19:00 bookings for today are not allowed. No restrictions if empty.
- **wbe_permited_arrivalweek_days** - For which weekdays the booking engine permits arrivals. No restrictions if empty.

item.description:
The Order Object in Clock POS represents a **transaction** of adding or removing charges to/from folios. The Order itself is used in Clock POS for printing of a customer receipt for newly added charges to a client's folio. If you add three menu items (Coke, Coffee and Snack) to a table, the Order will contain these three charges. Orders are also created for Voids and Transfers (between folios or to the PMS). The Transfers are the most complicated case, as the Order will contain charges from different folios (negative ones from the source folios, and positive ones to the destination folios). For this reason, the Order doesn't have a folio_id attribute - it can have multiple related folios.

**A notification is fired on order creation. More details in “Message Channels” section. **
