item.description:
## Overview With Clock Payment API, hotels can perform custom payment services for collecting payments from their guests. This way a hotel can develop an interface for a payment service provider or bank not supported by the standard Clock PMS payment interfaces. ## Where can the interface be used? The interface can be used in all customer-faced add-ons as: Web Reservation System (for booking guarantee deposits); Self Service Portal (for booking guarantee deposits or final checkout payments); Gift Voucher Shop (buying gift vouchers). The interface cannot be used in Clock PMS back office. ## How does the interface work? The Clock PMS Payment Interface is a Server-to-Server interface. An HTTPS is required. Each payment is processed in four steps (the last step is optional): 1. A user is redirected from the Clock Web Reservation System to the Payment Service URL. 2. The Payment Service server requests more data about the payment from the Clock PMS server. 3. The Payment Service server confirms the payment to the Clock PMS server. 4. The User is redirected to the Clock Web Reservation System (optional). ## Details of each step Case: A User decides to book a room in the web reservation system. At the last step, the same chooses to pay by credit card. Actually, this option is preset in the custom payment service. ### 1. The User is redirected from Clock Web Reservation System to ### Payment Service URL. Clock PMS redirects the User to the payment interface URL, which is preset in the settings of Clock PMS ('Other' – 'Settings' – 'Custom payment API' – Service URL field ). To the set URL, two standard parameters ( **pms_id, pms_token** ) are added. These two parameters are used for payment confirmation at the next step. Service URL example: >**https://some-payment-service.com/some-page? pms_id=40&pms_token=b62eea05-3bae-437e-9cbe-52ec8a858ad** In case of a parameter name conflict, the names of the parameters (parameters prefixes) can be changed: from 'pms_' to any other string. The prefix can be changed on the Clock PMS Custom Payment Interface setting screen (Other - Settings) ### 2. Payment Service server requests more data about the payment from ### Clock PMS server The Payment Service has to retrieve the requested data through the pms_id parameter, using the custom_payment_purchases function of the Base API. For example, apart from the value ( **value_cents** ) and the currency ( **currency** ) of the request, the URLs sent to the client upon the transaction completion ( **complete_url, cancel_url** ) and the transaction description ( **description** ) can also be retrieved, as well as the available client details or other information ( **custom** ). >**https://sky-eu1.clock-software.com/base_api/ 2020/1695/custom_payment_purchases/ 40** ### 3. Payment Service server confirmation of a payment to the Clock PMS ### server If a user has made a successful payment, the payment service server has to confirm the payment request in Clock PMS. This is done by executing the HTTP PUT of the same URS, which has been used for the request data retrieval at the previous step. Additionally, two mandatory parameters are to be added: **token** (received at step 1 as 'pms_token') **and transaction_reference** (some id/number from payment service for reference). A successful payment will result in the sending of any of the following: confirmation letter, registration of the payment with a database, folio closing, etc. Example: >**PUT** to: **https://sky-eu1.clock-software.com/base_api/2020/1695/custom_payment_purchases/ 40**
>With parameters:
>**token** = “b62eea05-3bae-437e-9cbe-52ec8a858ad9”
>**transaction_reference** = “ref-00000000001” For the payments that are unsuccessful or cancelled by the User, no action is required. ### 4. Redirecting a User to the Clock Web Reservation System (optional) It is recommended (but optional) that the Payment Service server redirects the User back to the Clock PMS system upon a successful or failed payment. The URL-s in the event of a successful or failed payment ( **complete_url, cancel_url)** can be obtained from the purchase object via API call ( step 2 ). Example complete_url: >https://sky-eu1.clock- >software.com/2020/1695/wbe/en/carts/155/completed? >wbe_session=e2I2NC9VVEYtOH1tejVLZXdzRlk0dGdmMG9zamJlYW4ybEl2U0FUQk >pFdlExdGQvbmVCLzlBPQo%3D Example cancel_url: >https://sky-eu1.clock-software.com/2020/1695/wbe/en/cart/edit? >product_search%5Badult_count%5D=2&product_search%5Barrival >%5D=15+Sep+2015&product_search%5Bchildren_count >%5D=0&product_search%5Bnights >%5D=1&wbe_session=e2I2NC9VVEYtOH1tejVLZXdzRlk0dGdmMG9zamJlYW4ybEl >U0FUQkpFdlExdGQvbmVCLzlBPQo%3D

item.name: Door Key API
item.description:
--- ## Overview With the Clock Door Key API, hotels can connect a custom door key system to Clock PMS. Using this API and the native door key system API, the hotel can develop its own software “adapter” (interface) between the two systems. More information and details about the Clock PMS API can be found in “Clock PMS Base/PMS API” document. Reference to the door_keys requests. --- ## How will the users issue the room key cards? Clock PMS provides the necessary screens to the users for the key issuing process. The users do not exit the Clock PMS. They can use the arrival list and booking screens within Clock PMS to complete the key issuing tasks. As the Clock PMS booking data is used, no double entries for periods or guest names are required. This minimizes the risk of error and makes the process fast and efficient. --- ## How does the entire process looks like? Steps of the process: 1. **USER** : Selects the “Keys” button on the Arrival List or Booking Screen. The room, period and name appear on “Room Key” screen. The data can be changed if needed. After selecting the “Issue Original Key” button, you are prompted to swipe/encode the card. OPTIONAL: **If the door key issue process requires card id to be read,** Require Card ID **should be enabled in** Room Key Settings **so** **a popup screen for the** Card ID **to be read will appear.** 2. **Clock PMS** : The Clock PMS API sends an event notification of a “new door key” event to the Hotel Interface. 3. **Hotel Interface** : Receives event notification and requests all the data for the newly created DoorKey instance by calling the door_key API end point. 4. **Hotel Interface** : Sends an API call to the Key Card System. 5. **USER** : Swipes the card on the Key Card System encoder. 6. **Hotel interface (optional)** : Reads the result from the Key Card System and updates the status of the DoorKey instance in Clock PMS. 7. **USER** : Can continue with more cards or close the door key issuing screen in Clock PMS. --- ## Details of each step Case: A Receptionist needs to issue a room key card for a checking-in guest. ### 1\. The User opens the “Room Key” screen - The Receptionist locates a guest's booking in Clock PMS system (arrival or booking screen) and selects the “Keys” button. - A “Room Key” screen appears. - The room, guest name and stay period are pre-filled in from the booking. Hours (for 'From' and 'To' fields) can be selected by the user. Also default from/to hours can be defined in the Clock PMS settings - “Room Key settings”. _Room Key screen:_ - An optional “Encoder” field can be displayed on the screen if needed. Encoders are defined in “Settings” - “Room Key settings”. The selected encoder will be saved in the DoorKey instance. - Select the “Issue Original Key” button. - You will be prompted to swipe/encode the card. ### 2\. Clock PMS sends an Event notification - When a user presses “Issue Original Key” button, a new DoorKey instance is created. A single DoorKey instance represents a card issuing request for a single card. - In the DoorKey instance creation, an event notification is also sent. The Clock PMS API supports two event notification methods: HTTP Push (the Clock PMS server sends a HTTP POST request to the hotel server) and Long Pool (the hotel server listens for events on the URL on the Clock PMS server). Find more information about the two methods in “Clock PMS Base/PMS API” document. - The Event notification contains the Event Type ( **door_key_new** ) and DoorKey instance ID (for example: **1234** ). ### 3\. Hotel Interface gets DoorKey instance attributes - Use the DoorKey ID to get the attributes of the DoorKey instance via the door_key API end point (**"/pms_api/subscription_id:/account_id:/door_keys/:id"**). ``` GET request to:https://sky-eu1.clock-software.com/pms_api/2020/1695/door_keys/1234.xml Response: ``` ### 4\. Hotel Interface sends an API call to the key card system - The hotel needs to implement a software module that can convert a Clock PMS DoorKey instance into an API call to a specific key card issuing system. - Clock PMS DoorKey instance can provide optional attributes for “mapping” data between PMS and Key Card System: - **encoder_identifier** – a special field for each encoder in Clock PMS ('Settings' – 'Room Key Settings' – 'Room Key Encoders' - Edit) for 'mapping' purposes. - **room_door_code** – a special field in Clock PMS Rooms ('Settings – Room – Edit) for 'mapping' purposes. ### 5\. The User swipes the card on the encoder - Depending of the Key Card System encoder, the user needs to take actions to encode the card – swipe/put/touch. - As the prompt screen for this action is displayed during the event notification sending, it is possible to have a gap between the screen prompting the user to encode the card and the encoder being ready to encode the card. The gap depends on the overall network latency and the performance of the systems. If the gap is larger, it is possible to swipe the card, but without having any effect. Users should be informed about this possible gap. Also the encoder's 'waiting for card' notification (lamp or beep) can be turned on, if the encoder supports such notifications. ### 6\. Status update (optional) - After successful or unsuccessful card encoding, the hotel interface can update the status of the DoorKey instance in Clock PMS. Thus Clock PMS system shows a feedback about the action result. Error messages can also be saved in DoorKey instance for problem tracking and investigations. - To update a DoorKey instance send a **PUT** request to the door_key API end point. - https://sky-eu1.clock-software.com/pms_api/2020/1695/door_keys/1234.xml With parameters: - **issued_at** – date-time of successful request completion - **reference_system – your software or company name - **deleted_at** - date-time of successful request for card deletion. The 'Delete' card action can be used only if the system supports such an action. - **error_text** – Error received from the Key Card System or Hotel Interface. - **qr_code_text** \- If your - HTTP code **200** will be returned in case of success. Otherwise, the error code **500** and error description will be returned. ### 7\. More cards - You can continue with more cards for a booking by selecting the “Next Room Key” button. This will return a user to the “Room Key” screen where the same can create another DoorKey instance (Step 1). ## Special cases ### Card Copy Some of the door key card systems support the 'Card Copy' function. If your system supports or requires such functionality, you can use the 'Copy' button on the Room Key screen to issue a copy of an existing key card. With the 'Copy' function, a new DoorKey instance will be created. The attributes in the new instance will be copied from the original card. Such instances can be recognized by the **parent_key_id** attribute**.** For instances that are created as a copy of original, **parent_key_id** the attribute contains the ID of the original DoorKey instance**.** ### Card Delete If your Key Card System system supports card deletion, here are the specifics of this operation: - **USER** : Can select 'delete' for the existing card in the 'Room Key' screen. - **USER** : Prompted to swipe/read the card. Depending of your Key Card System, this may be required or not. If swiping/reading is not required by your Key Card System, you just need to click 'Cancel' to close the screen. - **Clock PMS** : The **delete_requested_at** attribute of the deleted DoorKey instance will be updated with the current date-time. - **Clock PMS** : An **door_key_update** event will be sent to the Hotel Interface. The event will contain DoorKey ID. - **Hotel Interface** : Receives event notification and requests all the data of the updated DoorKey instance by calling the door_key API end point. - **Hotel Interface** : Sends an API call to the Key Card System. - **Hotel Interface (optional)** : Reads the result from the Key Card System and updates the status of the DoorKey instance in Clock PMS. **deleted_at** can be set (with POST request) with the current date-time. ### Room Changes A booking in Clock PMS supports changing of the room of the guest during the stay. If the booking contains a room change, then the “Room Key” screen will render all rooms in the booking and you need to select the room the card will be issued for. Clock PMS supports card issuing in advance for all rooms related to the booking. However, this feature needs support from the Key Card System too. ### Multiple Encoders If you have multiple encoders in your hotel, you can configure the existing encoders in Clock PMS ('Settings' – Room Key Settings' – 'Room Key Encoders'). For each encoder, you can enter a name and encoder_identifier. Use encoder_identifier attribute for 'mapping' needs (IP Address, Port, your ID, etc.). If the encoders are configured, the encoder selection field will be shown on the “Room Key” screen. encoder_identifier attribute will be saved in DoorKey instance. ## Supported HTTP methods | Name (method) | URL | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | **Index (GET)** | **/pms_api/:subscription_id/:account_id/** | **Index of all DoorKey instances. Returns ID list. Accepts parameters (DoorKey attributes) for filtering.** | | Example: | `https://sky-eu1.clock-software.com/pms_api/2020/1695/door_keys.xml?id.gt=1234` | | | **Show (GET)** | **/pms_api/:subscription_id/:account_id/** | **Single DoorKey instance.** | | Example: | `https://sky-eu1.clock-software.com/pms_api/2020/1695/door_keys/1234.xml` | | | **Update (PUT)** | **/pms_api/:subscription_id/:account_id/** | **Updates an existing DoorKey instance.** | | Example: | PUT on `https://sky-eu1.clock-software.com/pms_api/2020/1695/door_keys/1234.xml` | With parameters:
\-**issued_at** – date-time of successful request completion
\-**reference_system** – your software or company
\-**deleted_at** - date-time of successful request for card deletion.
\-**error_text** – Error received from the Key Card System or Hotel Interface.
HTTP code **200** will be returned in case of success. Otherwise the error code **500** and error description will be returned. | ## DoorKey attributes | | | | | --- | --- | --- | | id | Not null | Unique ID of the DoorKey instance | | booking_id | Not null | ID of the related Booking | | room_id | Not null | ID of the Room | | room_name | Not null | Room name/number | | room_door_code | Optional | Optional attribute for “mapping” data between PMS and Key Card System | | qr_code_text | Optional | Optional attribute for userd for QR code door keys (if supported by the door lock system) | | encoder_id | Optional | ID of the selected encoder | | encoder_identifier | Optional | Optional attribute for “mapping” data between PMS and Key Card System (IP | | valid_from | Not null | From date/time of the key card validity | | valid_to | Not null | To date/time of the key card validity | | guest_name | Optional | Guest names | | issued_at | Optional | Date and Time of the successful key card completion returned by the Hotel Interface | | reference_system | Conditional | Required if issued_at is present. Your software or company name | | delete_requested_at | Optional | Date and Time of the key card deletion request | | deleted_at | Optional | Date and Time of the deletion returned by the Hotel Interface | | parent_key_id | Optional | ID of the parent DoorKey instance if the DoorKey is created through the 'Copy' function |

item.name: Yield Management API
Availability Adjustment

request.description:
All capacity adjustment days set. Optional: accepts the “date” parameter for query filtering. The Response can be in xml, json or yaml.
Example Request (adjustments between 1 Aug 2020 and 1 Sep 2020)

Updates Availability Adjustment. Multiple lines can be passed. Each line can be for 'date' or period ('from' and 'to').
POST with **'Content-Type': 'application/xml'** OR **'application/json'** OR **'application/yaml'** HTTP code **200** will be returned in case of success. Otherwise, the error code **500** and the error description will appear.

item.description:
The Availability Adjustment feature enables you to add or remove amounts from the available
(free) rooms for a room type. Thus you can stop the sales of a certain room type or increase the
availability and allow overbooking.
Please note that the “Availability Adjustment” adds or removes rooms to/from the current
availability. It doesn't override the free rooms numbers.
“Availability Adjustment” is associated with room types. Use the “room_types” API end-point for
the current hotel room types. Check the “Clock PMS Base/PMS API” for more information. For the
purposes of this this document, '7777' will be used as an example room_type_id.
From a user's point of view, the availability adjustment itself is shown on the Occupancy Forecast
screen. The user can also update the adjustment. All changes are logged and can be checked by
clicking the “Change Log” button on “Occupancy Forecast” screen.

item.description:
Use the Rate Price endpoint to update prices and rate restrictions in the Clock PMS rates. The

maximum period in time supported by the rate price update end-point is 2 years in the future. Past

days cannot be updated.

1 Rate in Clock PMS is for 1 Room Type or Room. 1 Room Type or Room can have 0 .. N Rates.

In order to update a Rate, you need its rate_id , so a mapping from your side is needed to map your

data to a Clock PMS rates. For the purposes of this this document, '888' will be used as an example

rate_id.

The money format is INTEGER in “cents”. Check “Clock Base and PMS API” for more

information. The currency is set in the rate and cannot be updated with the API.

A List of Rates, Room Types and Rooms can be found from the end-points: rates, room_types,

rooms. More information in “Clock Base and PMS API”.

*Rate price updating.*
Updates rate prices and/or restrictions.
Multiple lines can be used. Each line
can be for a 'date' or period ('from' and
'to').
Missing attributes will not be updated.
The "rate_restriction" is optional.

POST with **'Content-Type': 'application/xml'** OR **'application/json'** OR **'application/yaml'** 

HTTP code **200** will be returned in case of success. Otherwise, the error code **500** and the error
description will appear.


Date and Period lines can be mixed in one post body.

Example 1 – one date and price.
Example 2 – price for a period (from – to)
Example 3 – stop from sale restriction for a date.
Example 4 - price and all restrictions for a date
Example 5 – remove price and all restrictions for a date

## Overview

The Clock Yield Management API allows external systems to manage **hotel prices** and **availability**.

This document examines the update of rates and availability adjustment end-points.

The Clock PMS API also includes end-points for access to bookings, availability and rate requests,

as well as product requests. For more information on authentication, forms and limits of the API, as

well as other end-points, see “ **Clock PMS Base/PMS API** ” document.

item.name: Phonecalls API

request.description:
Adding an Array of Phone Calls to Clock PMS.
Parameters:
- **call_datetime** : Required. DateTime of the call being made. Bookings are searched by the Date of this field.
- **internal_line** : Required, String/255. Room is searched by this field.
- **duration** : Required for pricing method based on duration of the call: “Price per Unit” and “Price per Zone”. Time.
- **dial_number** : Required for pricing method based on Zones. String/255.
- **impulses** : Required for pricing method “Price per Unit”. Integer.
- **price** : Required for pricing method “Native Price”. Decimal/15.4
- **line**: Optional. String/255. Outgoing line/Provider name. Informational only

Adding an Array of Phone Calls to Clock PMS.
Parameters:
- **call_datetime** : Required. DateTime of the call being made. Bookings are searched by the Date of this field.
- **internal_line** : Required, String/255. Room is searched by this field.
- **duration** : Required for pricing method based on duration of the call: “Price per Unit” and “Price per Zone”. Time.
- **dial_number** : Required for pricing method based on Zones. String/255.
- **impulses** : Required for pricing method “Price per Unit”. Integer.
- **price** : Required for pricing method “Native Price”. Decimal/15.4
- **line**: Optional. String/255. Outgoing line/Provider name. Informational only

item.description:
#### For more information on authentication , forms and limits of the API, as well as

#### other end-points, see “ Clock PMS Base/PMS API ” document.

## Overview

The ClockPMS PBX API allows third party systems to **send phone call records** to the Clock PMS.

Here is a short overview of the process:

- The third party system (your system) is responsible for communicating with the PBX/Call
    accounting software, reading phone call data and sending phone call records to the Clock
    PMS Phone Calls API.
- Clock PMS receives phone calls (via the API) and calculates the price of the phone call,
    depending on the selected method and settings in Clock PMS.
- Clock PMS finds the Booking based on phone call “Internal line”. A special mapping
    (Rooms <> Internal Lines) is supported for this purpose. Clock PMS looks for the checked-
    in booking for the room and whether the call falls within the period of this booking. In case
    of multiple bookings found, the first one is selected
- Clock PMS charges the Booking folio with calculated price.
- Clock PMS provide a search screen for all received phone calls. Each phone call has a status
    in Clock PMS:
    - **Charged** – the call is successfully charged to the folio of a booking
    - **Uncharged** – the call is not charged to any booking. The related error is also attached.
    - **Ignored** – Phone calls which cannot be charged to a booking, can be ignored by the user.

The Clock PMS API also includes end-points for access to bookings, folios and folios charges,
including the possibility of direct folio charging.

For more information on authentication, forms and limits of the API, as well as other end-points,
see the “ **Clock PMS Base/PMS API** ” document.

The PBX functionality is a paid add-on. Contact a Clock Software Representative for more
information.

## Pricing Methods

Clock PMS supports the following methods to calculate the price of a phone call:

- **Native Price** – a price sent by your system. Use this method, if your system has a pricing
    feature.
 - In the 'Currency' field in ClockPMS - “Settings” - “Phone calls”, set the currency of the
charges to be posted to guest folios.
- **Price per Unit**. If calls are charged based on units (aka Impulses) in your PBX, the phone
    call charge that is posted to the guest's folio is a result of the multiplication of the respective
    units by the price per unit.
    - This price is set in the 'Price per unit' field in ClockPMS - “Settings” - “Phone calls”.
       The currency of the posted charge will be the one set in the 'Currency' field.
- **Price per Minute**. Fill in the 'Price per minute' field in Clock PMS - “Settings” - “Phone
    calls”. Each started minute of a phone call will be charged at this price. Once again the
    currency of the charge will be the one set in the 'Currency' field.
- **Price per Zone**. The price per minute of a telephone call can be determined by the zone of
    the dialled number and its prefix. The zones and corresponding prices are defined for each
    Clock PMS account by the User: Clock PMS - “Settings” - “Phone calls”- “Zones”

## Activity Control

To monitor activity, Clock PMS tracks “Last Activity” over this API end-point. If the
communication between your system and Clock PMS stops for more than 5 minutes, a “No
Communication” warning appears on the Home screen of Clock PMS.

The “Last Activity” is updated on each API call. In order to update the “Last Activity” field, you
need to send an empty POST (“Hello”) request to the Phone Calls API end-point on every 1 minute.

item.name: OTA Channel Connect API

request.description:
Clock PMS+ is the active side in the process of message exchange. At an interval of 5 minutes -download of the new

reservations and respectively push of availability, prices, restrictions and LOS is performed by ClockPMS.

In ClockPMS for each account (hotel/property), an URL endpoint of your service is set.
E.g. https://app.your_domain.com/clockpms.
ClockPMS would send **ALL** messages to the configured URL. You can recognize the message based on it's OTA message type The expected OTA message types are as follows: - **OTA_PingRQ** - Service Health Check request - **OTA_HotelAvailNotifRQ** – Availability, LOS, Restrictions - **OTA_HotelRateAmountNotifRQ** - Prices - **OTA_ReadRQ** - New Bookings download request - **OTA_NotifReportRQ** – Booking confirmation request As the setting of the endpoint URL for each individual account (hotel) is in Clock, it is possible to use different endpoint URLs for each one of your customers or the same one for all. Choose the best option for you. Examples of individual endpoint URLs for different customers can be found below: Central Hotel: https://app.your_domain.com/clockpms/central_hotel City Hotel: https://app.your_domain.com/clockpms/city_hotel Please also refer to the point below in order to choose the best organization of your endpoints.

body.raw:
<env:Envelope
	xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"
	xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchemainstance"
	xmlns:ota="http://www.clock-software.com/ota_channel_connect"
	xmlns:env="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/
soap/envelope/">
	<env:Header>
		<wsse:Security
			xmlns:wsse="http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-wssecurity-secext1.0.xsd">
			<wsse:UsernameToken
				xmlns:wsu="http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-wssecurityutility-1.0.xsd" wsu:Id="UsernameToken-1">
				<wsse:Username>****</wsse:Username>
				<wsse:Password Type="http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-username-token-profile1.0#PasswordText">****</wsse:Password>
			</wsse:UsernameToken>
		</wsse:Security>
	</env:Header>
	<env:Body>
		<OTA_ReadRQ
			xmlns="http://www.opentravel.org/OTA/2003/05" EchoToken="5c0b61e3-1a7b-421a-95a5-88b2493f2ac2"
TimeStamp="2020-05-21T10:46:17+03:00" Version="1.0">
			<POS>
				<Source>
					<RequestorID ID="CLOCKPMS" Type="22"/>
				</Source>
			</POS>
			<ReadRequests>
				<HotelReadRequest HotelCode="******">
					<SelectionCriteria SelectionType="Undelivered"/>
				</HotelReadRequest>
			</ReadRequests>
		</OTA_ReadRQ>
	</env:Body>
</env:Envelope>

request.description:
There are 3 fields for setting of access and addressee in Clock PMS. You need to provide these fields. The credentials

are used in each request sent by ClockPMS:

- User name: **<wsse:Username>**
- Password: **<wsse:Password>**

Addressee (to which specific hotel the message is related)

- Hotel Code: the attribute **HotelCode** can be found in various places for the different requests. Please check

each specific request.

You will have to decide if the credentials would be individual for each hotel or the same for all.

Example:

body.raw:
<env:Envelope
	xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"
	xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchemainstance"
	xmlns:ota="http://www.clock-software.com/ota_channel_connect"
	xmlns:env="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/
soap/envelope/">
	<env:Header>
		<wsse:Security
			xmlns:wsse="http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-wssecurity-secext1.0.xsd">
			<wsse:UsernameToken
				xmlns:wsu="http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-wssecurityutility-1.0.xsd" wsu:Id="UsernameToken-1">
				<wsse:Username>****</wsse:Username>
				<wsse:Password Type="http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-username-token-profile1.0#PasswordText">****</wsse:Password>
			</wsse:UsernameToken>
		</wsse:Security>
	</env:Header>
	<env:Body>
====== REQUEST MESSAGE HERE ======
 </env:Body>
</env:Envelope>

request.description:
Please note that the messages sent from our end are always “packaged” as SOAP. The SOAP envelope should be considered as a part of the XML. Mandatory message format:
⚠️ In the examples below, the SOAP envelope is skipped for brevity. In the examples below, the SOAP envelope is skipped for brevity.

The response messages sent as a reply to our requests must have the following envelope:
⚠️ In the examples below, the SOAP envelope is skipped for brevity. In the examples below, the SOAP envelope is skipped for brevity.

Please note that within one synchronization cycle (each 5 minutes):

- **The sequence and order of the request types is not guaranteed.** In other words, all requests from

ClockPMS are first prepared and then sent asynchronously without any specific order.

- Requests can be delivered **in parallel** to your server.
- Availability, Prices, Restrictions and LOS requests contain up to **480** elements (detailed line), thus within one

synchronization cycle you may **receive a few messages of the same type.**

- **Deltas**. Availability, Prices, Restrictions and LOS requests **only** contain **the changes from the last cycle.**

The first message will have the whole information, while every next one – only the changes from the last

cycle. If you would like to receive the full update of the availability, prices or restrictions, please contact our

support department and they will perform a procedure for re-synchronization.

- Availability, Prices and Restrictions data is exported for **364 days ahead** from the current date.

For each request sent (RQ), ClockPMS will require a response (RS) that the message is well received. An error should be generated in case of: - Incorrect credentials - Issue with the hotel code or service activation - Issue with the message parsing - Issue related to the mapping of room types or rates Errors related to business logic processing of the messages or their transfer to the channels are not expected as this would generate repeatedly re-send of data from our end until status “Success” is received. Business logic errors should be communicated to the customers directly by you and once the issue is resolved, a new re-synchronization is to be requested from ClockPMS support department. If for a specific request, ClockPMS receives an http error, timeout or the **** element is missing in the response, then we consider the changes as not accepted. In the next export cycle, the data, which was marked as not accepted on your end, will be pushed again. For easier detection of the issue, the custom error codes could be also added to the response : . Please note that the error text is mandatory, while the error code is not. The text of the error as well as the code returned from your end will be shown to the user.
``` ``` Error example: ``` Hotel with HotelCode='*****' is not enabled for inventory updates ```

The EchoToken element **must** be presented in the response. The response EchoToken should be exactly the same as the

one within the Request.

Example Request:

```
<OTA_PingRQ
	xmlns="http://www.opentravel.org/OTA/2003/05" EchoToken="7b1b1f5e-872f-4ff9-a860-e0bed02aec54"
TimeStamp="2020-05-21T10:00:46+03:00" Version="1.0">
	<EchoData>Successful connection to OTA service</EchoData>
</OTA_PingRQ>
```
Ezample Response:
```
<OTA_PingRS
	xmlns="http://www.opentravel.org/OTA/2003/05" EchoToken="7b1b1f5e-872f-4ff9-a860-e0bed02aec54"
TimeStamp="2020-05-21T07:00:49.0Z" Version="1.0">
	<Success/>
	<EchoData>Successful connection to OTA service</EchoData>
</OTA_PingRS>
```

item.name: Data Mapping and Room Type / Rate Structure

request.description:
Maps of Room Types and Rates from ClockPMS to your system is supported. ClockPMS exports data only of room

types and rates added to the channel manager mapping.

ClockPMS room types and rates structure clarification:

- 1 RoomType **has** 0..n Rates

- 1 Rate **belongs to** 1 Room Type

Example:

- Room Type DBL (id:1) -- mapped to **“Double Room”**
- Rate DBL RO (id:11) -- mapped to **“Double-R.O.”**
- Rate DBL BB (id:12) -- mapped to **“Double-B.B.”**
- Room Type APP (id:2) -- mapped to **“Apartment”**
- Rate APP RO (id:13) -- mapped to **“Apartment-R.O.”**
- Rate APP BB (id:14) -- mapped to **“Apartment-B.B.”**

If the structure above does not correspond to yours, you may change the ClockPMS mapping instead.

Example:

- Room Type DBL (id:1) -- mapped to **“Double Room”**
- Rate DBL RO (id:11) -- mapped to **“R.O.”**
- Rate DBL BB (id:12) -- mapped to **“B.B.”**
- Room Type APP (id:2) -- mapped to **“Apartment”**
- Rate APP RO (id:13) -- mapped to **“R.O.”**
- Rate APP BB (id:14) -- mapped to **“B.B.”**


Two ClockPMS room types **CANNOT** be mapped to one and the same code.

- Room Type DBL (id:1) -- mapped to **“Double”**
- Room Type APP (id:2) -- mapped to **“Double”**

One ClockPMS room types **CANNOT** be mapped to **MORE** than one code.

- Room Type DBL (id:1) -- mapped to **“Double”**
- Room Type DBL (id:1) -- mapped to **“Twin”**

item.name: Ping
item.description:
The Ping message ( **OTA_PingRQ** ) is used by ClockPMS users for the verification of the credentials and the URL

endpoint.

However, it cannot check, if the hotel code is correct. This message implementation is not required.

Request:

```
<OTA_PingRQ
	xmlns="http://www.opentravel.org/OTA/2003/05" EchoToken="7b1b1f5e-872f-4ff9-a860-e0bed02aec54"
TimeStamp="2020-05-21T10:00:46+03:00" Version="1.0">
	<EchoData>Successful connection to OTA service</EchoData>
</OTA_PingRQ>
```
Success:

```
<OTA_PingRS
	xmlns="http://www.opentravel.org/OTA/2003/05" EchoToken="7b1b1f5e-872f-4ff9-a860-e0bed02aec54"
TimeStamp="2020-05-21T07:00:49.0Z" Version="1.0">
	<Success/>
	<EchoData>Successful connection to OTA service</EchoData>
</OTA_PingRS>
```
Error:

```
<OTA_PingRS
	xmlns="http://www.opentravel.org/OTA/2003/05" EchoToken="7b99add6-fe60-4082-a6e8-f0955c9b5043"
TimeStamp="2020-05-21T11:46:00+00:00" Version="1.0">
	<Errors>
		<Error Type="4">Authentication failed - invalid username/password</Error>
	</Errors>
</OTA_PingRS>
```

item.name: Availability, Restrictions and LOS

request.description:
The message contains the number of available rooms for each room type:

- **AvailStatusMessage.BookingLimit** – free rooms count


- **AvailStatusMessage.StatusApplicationControl.InvTypeCode** – room type code

- **AvailStatusMessage.StatusApplicationControl.Start** – Start date (inclusive)

- **AvailStatusMessage.StatusApplicationControl.End** – End date (inclusive)

Request:

```
<OTA_HotelAvailNotifRQ
	xmlns="http://www.opentravel.org/OTA/2003/05" EchoToken="e0bc7160-7037-4453-956c-
071143e928cb" TimeStamp="2020-05-18T12:56:46+03:00" Version="1.0">
	<POS>
		<Source>
			<RequestorID ID="CLOCKPMS" Type="22"/>
		</Source>
	</POS>
	<AvailStatusMessages HotelCode="******">
		<AvailStatusMessage BookingLimit="5">
			<StatusApplicationControl Start="2020-05-18" End="2020-05-18" InvTypeCode="DR"/>
		</AvailStatusMessage>
		<AvailStatusMessage BookingLimit="6">
			<StatusApplicationControl Start="2020-05-19" End="2021-05-17" InvTypeCode="DR" />
		</AvailStatusMessage>
		<AvailStatusMessage BookingLimit="11">
			<StatusApplicationControl Start="2020-05-18" End="2020-10-21" InvTypeCode="APP" />
		</AvailStatusMessage>
		<AvailStatusMessage BookingLimit="8">
			<StatusApplicationControl Start="2020-10-22" End="2021-05-17" InvTypeCode="APP" />
		</AvailStatusMessage>
	</AvailStatusMessages>
</OTA_HotelAvailNotifRQ>
```
Response:

```
<OTA_HotelAvailNotifRS
	xmlns="http://www.opentravel.org/OTA/2003/05" Version="1.0" TimeStamp="2020-05-
18T09:56:50+00:00" EchoToken="e0bc7160-7037-4453-956c-071143e928cb">
	<Success/>
</OTA_HotelAvailNotifRS>
```

item.name: Restrictions (Closed, Closed for Arrival, Closed for Departure)

request.description:
Three rate restrictions are managed via this message:

- Closed – specific day/period for which the rate/room type is stopped for sale / not available

- Closed for Arrival - specific day/period for which the rate/room type is closed for arrival

- Closed for Departure - specific day/period for which the rate/room type is closed for departure

   - **AvailStatusMessage.StatusApplicationControl.InvTypeCode** – room type code

   - **AvailStatusMessage.StatusApplicationControl.RatePlanCode** – rate code

   - **AvailStatusMessage.StatusApplicationControl.Start** – Start date (inclusive)

   - **AvailStatusMessage.StatusApplicationControl.End** – End date (inclusive)

   - **AvailStatusMessage.RestrictionStatus.Restriction –** missing, “Arrival” or “Departure”. It clarifies which restriction should exactly be updated, if missing is referred to Close Date.

   - **AvailStatusMessage.RestrictionStatus.Status -** “Open” or “Closed”. Specify if restriction should be applied or removed.

```
<OTA_HotelAvailNotifRQ
	xmlns="http://www.opentravel.org/OTA/2003/05" EchoToken="0215323b-e518-4e4c-872b-
7fef99890a96" TimeStamp="2020-05-18T13:49:37+03:00" Version="1.0">
	<POS>
		<Source>
			<RequestorID ID="CLOCKPMS" Type="22"/>
		</Source>
	</POS>
	<AvailStatusMessages HotelCode="****">
		<AvailStatusMessage>
			<StatusApplicationControl End="2020-05-25" InvTypeCode="DR" RatePlanCode="K1" Start="2020-05-18"/>
			<RestrictionStatus Status="Open"/>
		</AvailStatusMessage>
		<AvailStatusMessage>
			<StatusApplicationControl End="2021-05-17" InvTypeCode="DR" RatePlanCode="K2" Start="2020-05-26"/>
			<RestrictionStatus Status="Close"/>
		</AvailStatusMessage>
		<AvailStatusMessage>
			<StatusApplicationControl End="2020-05-25" InvTypeCode="DR" RatePlanCode="K3" Start="2020-05-18"/>
			<RestrictionStatus Restriction="Arrival" Status="Open"/>
		</AvailStatusMessage>
		<AvailStatusMessage>
			<StatusApplicationControl End="2021-05-17" InvTypeCode="DR" RatePlanCode="K4" Start="2020-05-26"/>
			<RestrictionStatus Restriction="Arrival" Status="Close"/>
		</AvailStatusMessage>
		<AvailStatusMessage>
			<StatusApplicationControl End="2020-05-25" InvTypeCode="AP" RatePlanCode="K5" Start="2020-05-18"/>
			<RestrictionStatus Restriction="Departure" Status="Open"/>
		</AvailStatusMessage>
		<AvailStatusMessage>
			<StatusApplicationControl End="2021-05-17" InvTypeCode="AP" RatePlanCode="K6" Start="2020-05-26"/>
			<RestrictionStatus Restriction="Departure" Status="Close"/>
		</AvailStatusMessage>
	</AvailStatusMessages>
</OTA_HotelAvailNotifRQ>
```
Response:

```
<OTA_HotelAvailNotifRS
	xmlns="http://www.opentravel.org/OTA/2003/05" Version="1.0" TimeStamp="2020-05-
18T09:56:50+00:00" EchoToken="0215323b-e518-4e4c-872b-7fef99890a96">
	<Success/>
</OTA_HotelAvailNotifRS>
```

With this request minimum as well as maximum restriction for the length of stay of rate and room type can be

respectively added or removed. In order to remove the restriction MinLOS: 1 or MaxLOS: 999 should be sent.

- **AvailStatusMessage.StatusApplicationControl.InvTypeCode** – room type code

- **AvailStatusMessage.StatusApplicationControl.RatePlanCode** – rate code

- **AvailStatusMessage.StatusApplicationControl.Start** – Start date (inclusive)

- **AvailStatusMessage.StatusApplicationControl.End** – End date (inclusive)

- **AvailStatusMessage.LengthsOfStay.LengthOfStay.MinMaxMessageType –** to which restriction exactly we refer: "SetMinLOS" or “SetMaxLOS”

- **AvailStatusMessage.LengthsOfStay.LengthOfStay.Time** – number of nights for which the restriction is applied

```
<OTA_HotelAvailNotifRQ
	xmlns="http://www.opentravel.org/OTA/2003/05" EchoToken="401c3129-a9b7-40b2-be73-
4feac81854cc" TimeStamp="2020-05-18T13:03:20+03:00" Version="1.0">
	<POS>
		<Source>
			<RequestorID ID="CLOCKPMS" Type="22"/>
		</Source>
	</POS>
	<AvailStatusMessages HotelCode="****">
		<AvailStatusMessage>
			<StatusApplicationControl Start="2020-05-23" End="2020-05-24" InvTypeCode="DR" RatePlanCode="KL"/>
			<LengthsOfStay>
				<LengthOfStay MinMaxMessageType="SetMinLOS" Time="2"/>
				<LengthOfStay MinMaxMessageType="SetMaxLOS" Time="5"/>
			</LengthsOfStay>
		</AvailStatusMessage>
		<AvailStatusMessage>
			<StatusApplicationControl Start="2020-05-25" End="2021-05-17" InvTypeCode="DR" RatePlanCode="KL"/>
			<LengthsOfStay>
				<LengthOfStay MinMaxMessageType="SetMinLOS" Time="1"/>
				<LengthOfStay MinMaxMessageType="SetMaxLOS" Time="999"/>
			</LengthsOfStay>
		</AvailStatusMessage>
		<AvailStatusMessage>
			<StatusApplicationControl Start="2020-05-23" End="2021-05-17" InvTypeCode="APP" RatePlanCode="ZK"/>
			<LengthsOfStay>
				<LengthOfStay MinMaxMessageType="SetMinLOS" Time="1"/>
				<LengthOfStay MinMaxMessageType="SetMaxLOS" Time="999"/>
			</LengthsOfStay>
		</AvailStatusMessage>
	</AvailStatusMessages>
</OTA_HotelAvailNotifRQ>
```
Response:

```
<OTA_HotelAvailNotifRS
	xmlns="http://www.opentravel.org/OTA/2003/05" Version="1.0" TimeStamp="2020-05-
18T09:56:50+00:00" EchoToken="401c3129-a9b7-40b2-be73-4feac81854cc">
	<Success/>
</OTA_HotelAvailNotifRS>
```

item.description:
Availability, Restrictions and LOS are exported as separate messages, but all are under the **OTA_HotelAvailNotifRQ**

endpoint and structure.

Identical consecutive days (same attribute values) are collected in one period line. Please check the example.

Messages are exported repeatedly until confirmed with a response containing <Success/>.

item.name: Rates
item.description:
Identical consecutive days (the same attribute values) are collected in one period line. Please check the example.

Messages are exported repeatedly until confirmed with a response containing <Success/>.

The currency used for the price export is the one configured as a currency in the ClockPMS rate.

Prices sent are considered to be of one type only – per room per night. Despite the tag being called BaseByGuestAmts,

the price is for room only and is NOT dependable on the number of guests.

Different tax modes are supported by ClockPMS. For instance, US users most often opt to work with tax excluded

mode, while European users – tax included. Depending on what mode is applied for the specific account you may

receive prices with tax included or excluded as follows:

- Tax included: AmountAfterTax
- Tax excluded: AmountBeforeTax

  **RateAmountMessage.StatusApplicationControl.InvTypeCode** – room type code

  **RateAmountMessage.StatusApplicationControl.RatePlanCode** – rate code

  **RateAmountMessage.Rates.Rate.Start** – Start date (inclusive)

  **RateAmountMessage.Rates.Rate.End** – End date (inclusive)

  **RateAmountMessage.Rates.Rate.CurrencyCode –** ISO currency code

  **RateAmountMessage.Rates.Rate.BaseByGuestAmts.BaseByGuestAmt.AmountAfterTax (or**

  **AmountBeforeTax)** – price per room per night

```
<OTA_HotelRateAmountNotifRQ
	xmlns="http://www.opentravel.org/OTA/2003/05" EchoToken="fb08e558-4c39-49b6-a4d0-
e1f551659b8a" TimeStamp="2020-05-18T13:01:14+03:00" Version="1.0">
	<POS>
		<Source>
			<RequestorID ID="CLOCKPMS" Type="22"/>
		</Source>
	</POS>
	<RateAmountMessages HotelCode="****">
		<RateAmountMessage>
			<StatusApplicationControl InvTypeCode="DR" RatePlanCode="KL"/>
			<Rates>
				<Rate CurrencyCode="EUR" Start="2020-05-18" End="2020-05-20">
					<BaseByGuestAmts>
						<BaseByGuestAmt AmountAfterTax="120.0"/>
					</BaseByGuestAmts>
				</Rate>
				<Rate CurrencyCode="EUR" Start="2020-05-21" End="2021-05-17">
					<BaseByGuestAmts>
						<BaseByGuestAmt AmountAfterTax="100.0"/>
					</BaseByGuestAmts>
				</Rate>
			</Rates>
		</RateAmountMessage>
		<RateAmountMessage>
			<StatusApplicationControl InvTypeCode="APP" RatePlanCode="ZK"/>
			<Rates>
				<Rate CurrencyCode="EUR" Start="2020-05-19" End="2021-05-17">
					<BaseByGuestAmts>
						<BaseByGuestAmt AmountAfterTax="220.0"/>
					</BaseByGuestAmts>
				</Rate>
			</Rates>
		</RateAmountMessage>
	</RateAmountMessages>
</OTA_HotelRateAmountNotifRQ>
```
Response:

```
<OTA_HotelRateAmountNotifRS
	xmlns="http://www.opentravel.org/OTA/2003/05" Version="1.0" TimeStamp="2020-05-
18T09:56:50+00:00" EchoToken="fb08e558-4c39-49b6-a4d0-e1f551659b8a">
	<Success/>
</OTA_HotelRateAmountNotifRS>
```

item.name: Booking Messages

body.raw:
<OTA_ReadRQ
	xmlns="http://www.opentravel.org/OTA/2003/05" EchoToken="5c0b61e3-1a7b-421a-95a5-88b2493f2ac2"
TimeStamp="2020-05-21T10:46:17+03:00" Version="1.0">
	<POS>
		<Source>
			<RequestorID ID="CLOCKPMS" Type="22"/>
		</Source>
	</POS>
	<ReadRequests>
		<HotelReadRequest HotelCode="******">
			<SelectionCriteria SelectionType="Undelivered"/>
		</HotelReadRequest>
	</ReadRequests>
</OTA_ReadRQ>

request.description: **SelectionType="Undelivered"** is always requested

Response with new bookings, modifications and cancellations. 
The diferent statuses are expected in **'ResStatus'** field wiht the following values:
- 'Book'
- 'Modify'
- 'Cancel'


The example below contains the minimum required

fields only. Please check “ **All booking field** s” chapter for full booking description.

```
<OTA_ResRetrieveRS
	xmlns="http://www.opentravel.org/OTA/2003/05" Version="1.0" TimeStamp="2018-10-
15T09:32:47+08:00" EchoToken="5c0b61e3-1a7b-421a-95a5-88b2493f2ac2">
	<Success/>
	<ReservationsList>
		<HotelReservation CreateDateTime="2018-10-15T08:51:45.000+0000" ResStatus="Book">
			<POS>
				<Source>
					<BookingChannel Primary="true">
						<CompanyName Code="EXP">Expedia</CompanyName>
					</BookingChannel>
				</Source>
			</POS>
			<UniqueID Type="14" ID="EXP-001"/>
			<UniqueID Type="16" ID="1243132" ID_Context="MESSAGE_UNIQUE_ID"/>
			<RoomStays>
				<RoomStay>
					<RoomRates>
						<RoomRate RoomTypeCode="DR" RatePlanCode="RAC1" NumberOfUnits="1">
							<Rates>
								<Rate RateTimeUnit="Day" EffectiveDate="2018-10-17" ExpireDate="2018-10-19">
									<Base AmountBeforeTax="200.00" AmountAfterTax="220.00" CurrencyCode="EUR"/>
								</Rate>
							</Rates>
						</RoomRate>
					</RoomRates>
					<GuestCounts>
						<GuestCount AgeQualifyingCode="10" Count="1"/>
					</GuestCounts>
					<TimeSpan Start="2018-10-17" End="2018-10-19"/>
					<Total AmountAfterTax="440.00" CurrencyCode="EUR"/>
					<ResGuestRPHs>
						<ResGuestRPH RPH="1"/>
					</ResGuestRPHs>
				</RoomStay>
			</RoomStays>
			<ResGuests>
				<ResGuest ResGuestRPH="1" Age="8" PrimaryIndicator="true">
					<Profiles>
						<ProfileInfo>
							<Profile ProfileType="1">
								<Customer>
									<PersonName>
										<GivenName>James</GivenName>
										<MiddleName>Herbert</MiddleName>
										<Surname>Bond</Surname>
									</PersonName>
									<Telephone PhoneNumber="213451515"/>
									<Email>james.bond@mi5.co.uk</Email>
								</Customer>
							</Profile>
						</ProfileInfo>
					</Profiles>
				</ResGuest>
			</ResGuests>
		</HotelReservation>
	</ReservationsList>
</OTA_ResRetrieveRS>
```
⚠️ In the examples below, the SOAP envelope is skipped for brevity. Please check all possible booking fields in the “All Booking Fields”

Response, if there are no new messages:

```
<OTA_ResRetrieveRS
	xmlns="http://www.opentravel.org/OTA/2003/05" Version="1.0" TimeStamp="2005-08-01T09:31:00+08:00" EchoToken="5c0b61e3-1a7b-421a-95a5-88b2493f2ac2">
	<Success/>
</OTA_ResRetreiveRS>
```
Error response:

```
<OTA_ResRetrieveRS
	xmlns="http://www.opentravel.org/OTA/2003/05" Version="1.0" TimeStamp="2005-08-01T09:31:00+08:00" EchoToken="5c0b61e3-1a7b-421a-95a5-88b2493f2ac2">
	<Errors>
		<Error Type="3" Code="392">Invalid Hotel Code</Error>
	</Errors>
</OTA_ResRetreiveRS>
```

Confirmation that ClockPMS has received the bookings.

**UniqueID.ID** will be the same as in the previous OTA_ResRetrieveRS - **UniqueID.ID ( Type="16"**

**ID_Context="MESSAGE_UNIQUE_ID" )**

**HotelReservationID.ResID_Value** is the booking numbers in ClockPMS (separated by ‘;’).

```
<OTA_NotifReportRQ EchoToken="ee138158-678b-4ddb-b183-8bc0f260f6db" TimeStamp="2018-10-01T12:00:02+03:00"
Version="1.0"
	xmlns="http://www.opentravel.org/OTA/2003/05">
	<Success />
	<NotifDetails>
		<HotelNotifReport>
			<HotelReservations>
				<HotelReservation CreateDateTime="2018-10-01T12:00:00+03:00" ResStatus="Book">
					<UniqueID ID="1243132" Type="16" />
					<ResGlobalInfo>
						<HotelReservationIDs>
							<HotelReservationID ResID_Type="14" ResID_Value="1; 2" />
						</HotelReservationIDs>
					</ResGlobalInfo>
				</HotelReservation>
			</HotelReservations>
		</HotelNotifReport>
	</NotifDetails>
</OTA_NotifReportRQ>
```
In case the booking is received in the Clock PMS “Inbox”, but cannot be imported automatically, we will return an

Error message. This message is for information purposes only. You can store the information in your log. if you support

such one. **This response should be treated the same way as <Success />**. The booking message should be removed

from your queue (marked as delivered) and **not** to be sent with the next OTA_ResRetrieveRS.

```
<OTA_NotifReportRQ EchoToken="ee138158-678b-4ddb-b183-8bc0f260f6db" TimeStamp="2018-10-01T12:00:01+03:00"
Version="1.0"
	xmlns="http://www.opentravel.org/OTA/2003/05">
	<Errors>
		<Error Type="3">Validation failed: Arrival room type can't be blank</Error>
	</Errors>
	<NotifDetails>
		<HotelNotifReport>
			<HotelReservations>
				<HotelReservation CreateDateTime="2018-10-01T12:00:00+03:00" ResStatus="Book">
					<UniqueID ID="1243132" Type="16" />
				</HotelReservation>
			</HotelReservations>
		</HotelNotifReport>
	</NotifDetails>
</OTA_NotifReportRQ>
```
⚠️ In the examples below, the SOAP envelope is skipped for brevity. If your system does **not** receive a booking confirmation (OTA_NotifReportRQ), then the

booking or modification should be resent with the next booking request OTA_ReadRQ / OTA_ResRetrieveRS
Your system returns a response to the confirmation message.

body.raw:
<OTA_ResRetrieveRS
	xmlns="http://www.opentravel.org/OTA/2003/05" Version="1.0" TimeStamp="2018-10-
15T09:32:47+08:00" EchoToken="ee138158-678b-4ddb-b183-8bc0f260f6db">
	<Success/>

request.description:
Example with all possible booking elements: | Name | A. | | |-|-|-| | OTA_ResRetrieveRS | 1 | | | Success
or
Errors | 1 | If no new messages are present – Success without ReservationsList is expected. | | ReservationsList | 0..1 | List of messages of new bookings, modifications and cancellations | | | | | | HotelReservation | 1..n | Each of the messages.
Each HotelReservation is a ClockPMS booking for 1 room. | | @CreateDateTime
or
@LastModifyDateTime | 1 | Creation date of the booking or modification/cancellation message. Based on this date, ClockPMS can ignore the booking, if it is created prior to the channel activation (old, existing bookings) | | @ResStatus | 1 | "Book": New booking;
“Modify”: Booking modification;
“Cancel”: Booking cancellation | | POS.Source.BookingChannel | 1 | | | @Primary | 1 | Always “true”. | | CompanyName | 1 | Name of the OTA channel (Expedia, Booking.com, ...) | | @Code | 1 | Code of the OTA channel. ClockPMS supports the mapping of codes to booking Agents. The OTA channel will be set as Agent in ClockPMS booking. See also the Profiles section. | | UniqueID | 2 | IDs of the booking. Two IDs are required here.
Also check this property: HotelReservation.ResGlobalInfo.HotelReservationIDs.HotelReservationID | | @Type | 1 | Type="14" – A unique booking number from your system. By this number ClockPMS will detect original booking to modify or cancel it.
If bookings can have multiple rooms in your system, you need to create a composite booking id using your existing ID and room number. Example: 123.1 is the booking id of your first room, 123.2 second room, etc.
Type="16" – Unique message ID. This ID is used by OTA_NotifReportRQ to notify your system of the successful message processing. | | @ID_Context | 0..1 | For Type="16" use ID_Context="MESSAGE_UNIQUE_ID" | | @ID | 1 | Booking ID | | | | | | RoomStays | 1 | | | RoomStay | 1 | In one @HotelReservation ONLY ONE RoomStays/RoomStay element is expected | | RoomRates | 1 | Booking Price information | | RoomRate | 1..n | Each combination of RoomType and RatePlan. Currently ClockPMS booking does NOT support different RoomTypes or RatePlans per day. That's why the RoomType and RatePlan from the first element will be used.
If your system supports different RoomTypes and RatePlan per day – pass the full data in the XML without data loss for future compatibility. | | @RoomTypeCode | 1 | Booking Room Type Code as mapped in Clock PMS. The ClockPMS booking is for one room type. | | @RatePlanCode | 1 | Rate Code as mapped in ClockPMS. The ClockPMS booking has one rate | | @NumberOfUnits | 1 | Always 1. | | Rates | 1 | | | Rate | 1..n | Different prices per day. You can combine the same prices in a period or day-by-day prices can be given. | | @RateTimeUnit | 1 | Always “Day” | | @EffectiveDate | 1 | From date (inclusive), the price is applied | | @ExpireDate | 1 | To date (NOT inclusive), the price is applied | | Base | 1 | Daily room/package price. Extra services () not included in this price | | @AmountBeforeTax | 1 | Before tax/vat. | | @AmountAfterTax | 1 | After tax/vat. | | @CurrencyCode | 1 | Currency code of the price | | ServiceRPHs | 0..1 | Add here reference to extra services. The full details of extra services are located in HotelReservation.Services. | | ServiceRPH | 1..n | | | @RPH | 1 | Reference (relation) | | GuestCounts | 0..1 | | | GuestCount | 1..n | Guest count for each age group | | @AgeQualifyingCode | 1 | “10” for Adults. “8” for Children | | @Count | 1 | Guest count for this age group | | TimeSpan | 1 | Booking period | | @Start | 1 | Arrival date | | @End | 1 | Departure date. | | Total | 1 | | | @AmountAfterTax,
@CurrencyCode | 1 | Total booking price and currency, including rooms, nights, taxes and extra services. | | ResGuestRPHs | 0..1 | Reference to the guests related to this booking. Guest data is located in ResGuests.
If no Guests are present, Profile of ProfileType="1" is used as Main Guest.
One of them is required - one Guest or Profile with ProfileType="1" | | ResGuestRPH | 1..n | | | @RPH | 1 | Guest Reference | | Comments.Comment.Text | 0..1 | Use this notes for booking Client Requests. For other unspecified notes use ResGlobalInfo.Comments | | | | | | Services | 0..1 | Extra services related to the booking | | Service | 1..n | A service | | @ServiceRPH | 1 | Internal reference of the Extra services. By this reference, extra services referenced in RoomStay.ServiceRPHs.ServiceRPH.RPH are located. | | @ServiceInventoryCode | 1 | ClockPMS supports the mapping of codes to “Charge Templates” needed for charging purposes. Provide all codes to the client for mapping. | | @Quantity | 1 | Quantity of the service. If ServiceDetails.TimeSpan exists the Quantity is used for each of the daily postings. If not – the charge is one-time only with this quantity. | | Price | 1 | | | Base | 1 | Price per 1 qty. | | @AmountBeforeTax | 1 | Before Tax | | @AmountAfterTax | 1 | After Tax | | @CurrencyCode | 1 | ISO Currency code | | RateDescription.Text | 1 | Text of the charge | | ServiceDetails.TimeSpan | 0..1 | Use this if the service is per day. The @Quantity will be posted on each day.
If not present – the service will be posted only once. | | @Start | 1 | Post charge from date (inclusive) | | @End | 1 | Post charge to date (NOT inclusive) | | | | | | ResGuests | 0..1 | Booking Guests Details | | ResGuest | 0..n | | | @ResGuestRPH | 1 | Reference of the guest (can be consecutive numbers: 1, 2, 3, ...). All references should be added to RoomStay.ResGuestRPHs | | @Age | 0..1 | Age of the guest/child if available. | | @PrimaryIndicator | 1 | "true" if this is the main booking guest | | Profiles.ProfileInfo.Profile | 0..1 | Personal guest data | | @ProfileType | 1 | Should be “1” | | Customer | 0..1 | | | PersonName | 0..1 | | | GivenName, MiddleName,
Surname | 0..1 | First, Middle and Last guest name | | Telephone | 0..n | Guest Phone numbers | | @PhoneNumber | 1 | | | Email | 0..1 | Guest email | | Address | 0..1 | | | AddressLine | 0..n | Address details | | CityName, PostalCode,
StateProv | 0..1 | City, ZIP, State | | CountryName | 0..1 | Two-letter ISO country code | | | | | | ResGlobalInfo | 1 | | | Guarantee | 0..1 | | | GuaranteesAccepted | 0..1 | | | GuaranteeAccepted | 0..1 | | | PaymentCard | 0..1 | Credit Card. Please refer to “PCI DSS” section. | | @CardNumber | 1 | Credit Card Number, Example: “4111111111111111” | | @ExpireDate | 1 | Card expire. “mmdd” format. Example: “1120” | | @SeriesCode | 0..1 | CVV, CVV2, CSC. | | CardHolderName | 1 | Card Holder Names | | GuaranteeDescription.Text | 0..1 | IMPORTANT. Provide information if the credit card is Virtual (Expedia Virtual Card, Booking.com VCC, etc.).
If the card is virtual, add “ VIRTUAL CREDITCARD ” text here. | | HotelReservationIDs | 1 | | | HotelReservationID | 1 | | | @ResID_Type="14" | 1 | Should be “14” | | @ResID_Value | 1 | Original OTA booking number. This number is placed as “Reference number” in the ClockPMS booking. This booking number is visible on most booking screens and searches. | | Profiles | 0..1 | Profiles connected to the booking | | ProfileInfo | 1..3 | Additional profiles can be linked to the booking.
“Contact Person” - used when the contact person is NOT a guest (will not stay at the hotel), but an “Organizer” instead. If this is not the case – don’t provide this additional profile as it will duplicate the main guest profile.
“Agent”. Additional Agent (different from the OTA channel itself). It can be an Agent from the GDS. If supplied, it will override the Channel as the Channel is the Agent by default.
“Company”. Corporate profile associated with the booking. Business traveller’s company. | | UniqueID | 0..1 | Required for Agent or Company profiles. Not used with Contact Person profiles. | | @Type | 1 | Alway “16” | | @ID_Context | 1 | Always "IATA" | | @ID | 1 | IATA number for Agents or VAT/ID number for Companies.
If no VAT/ID number is present for the Company – you can pass here any ID that can be used as a company identifier.
Agents with IATA number being present will be auto-created in the ClockPMS.
Companies will be searched by this ID via the VAT number in the ClockPMS database. Companies will not be auto-created. | | Profile | | | | @ProfileType | | “1” for a Contact Person. “3“ for a Company. “4” for an Agent. | | Customer | 1 | | | PersonName | 0..1 | | | @GivenName, @MiddleName,
@Surname | 0..1 | Person Name | | Telephone | 0..n | Phones | | @PhoneNumber | 1 | | | Email | 0..1 | Email | | Address | 0..1 | | | CompanyName | 0..1 | Name of the Agent or Company | | AddressLine | 0..n | Address lines | | CityName, PostalCode,
StateProv | 0..1 | Address details | | CountryName | 0..1 | Two letter ISO country code | | Comments | 0..1 | | | Comment | 1 | | | Text | 1 | General booking notes. For Client Request use RoomStay.Comments instead. |

ClockPMS bookings are for one room only. One ClockPMS booking corresponds to one **HotelReservation** element.

In order to create multiple bookings for one customer, you should create several different bookings (few

**HotelReservation** ) with identical data.

For the proper functioning of the modifications and cancellations in the respective modification/cancellation message,

the same ID ( in the HotelReservation.UniqueID, Type=”14”) as the one in the booking creation message should be

sent.

If the bookings on your end do not have a separate ID for each one of them, you may use composite IDs instead – your

IDs together with the consecutive room numbers. For example, if your booking has an ID of 123, the composite IDs

can be as follows 123.1, 123.2,etc.

One and the same “Reference number” should be sent for the multiple bookings ( group or family bookings ). This way,

bookings in ClockPMS will be shown as linked to one another. Reference number to be submitted in

ResGlobalInfo.HotelReservationID.ResID_Valueм ResID_Type="14"

Clock PMS is a certified PCI DSS Level 1 Service Provider. You can get a copy of our current AoC [**here**](https://drive.google.com/drive/u/1/folders/1b-Mb55dsAqu5VExqlUNcWr-34QDanYjB)**.**

Please send credit card data only once with the booking creation or on credit card change. Do not send the same card

twice, as it will be duplicated in the system.

If you support CVV (security code) for credit cards, please send it in the message, as many of the automated pre-

authorization, payment and tokenization functions may not work if the CVV is missing.

XML coloring thanks to: [http://hilite.me/](http://hilite.me/)

item.description:
The booking download, modification and cancellation can be performed through the message pairs: OTA_ReadRQ/

OTA_ResRetrieveRS, OTA_NotifReportRQ/ OTA_NotifReportRS**.**

OTA_ReadRQ. On each synchronization cycle, ClockPMS sends a request for the new messages (OTA_ReadRQ)

related to bookings – new, modified or cancelled ones. **SelectionType="Undelivered"** is always required.

OTA_ResRetrieveRS. Your system should respond to this request with OTA_ResRetrieveRS which contains the

bookings themselves. The mechanism, through which each new booking or modification to an already existing booking

will be sent only once if requested ( **"Undelivered"** ), should be implemented on your side.

OTA_NotifReportRQ. In order to avoid booking losses, once the booking from OTA_ReadRS is well received,

ClockPMS will send a booking confirmation containing the booking IDs. This is possible, once a message of the

OTA_NotifReportRQ type is sent.

OTA_NotifReportRS. Once the booking confirmation is received on your end, the message can be removed from the

queue (or be marked as successfully sent) and to respond respectively with OTA_NotifReportRS.

In cases of confirmation not received on your end (OTA_NotifReportRQ), the booking or its modification should be

resent with the next OTA_ReadRQ request.

item.name: Testing&Certification

request.description:
Please provide the below connection details to [integrations@clock-hs.com](mailto:integrations@clock-hs.com) so OTA API can be activated for your SANDBOX account:

*   **WSDL link or Endpoint link** (*if you have separate ones for test and production we will need both*)
*   **Requestor ID**
*   **User name**
*   **Password**
*   **Hotel code**
    

When the connection is configure and working properly you will be notified, so you can proceed and configure the Clock PMS+ room types and rates which shall be send via the interface.

**Settings > All Settings > OTA Channel Settings > Open**

Click on **Edit** to define the behavior of the interface:

[Here](https://support.clock-software.com/en/support/solutions/articles/9000178455-clock-pms-update-18-nov-2019-) (SITEMINDER and AVAILPRO – Import of Agents and Companies section) you can get more details about how the Company map is working.

**Room map** - Configure the room types to be exported. Please note a room type may be added with or without Room Type Code. If no Room Type Code is configured the Clock PMS+ room type code will be sent so you can define the mapping at your end. You can define new or update existing room types by going to All Settings > Room types.

**Rate map** - Select which rates to be exported. Please note a rate may be added with or without Rate Plan Code. If no Rate Plan Code is configured the Clock PMS+ rate plan code will be sent so you can define the mapping at your end. Per guests rates and guest offset levels are also supported by configuring the Adults and Children to be used for the calculation. You can define new or update existing Rate Plans and Rates by going to All Settings > Rate Plan. Using the price table there you can also edit prices and apply rate restrictions. Please note Clock PMS supports two sets of LOS restrictions:

*   Stay-through LOS (Minimum Stay and Max Stay)- handled by the interface;
    

*   LOS on Arrival (Min Stay on Arrival and Max Stay on Arrival) - **not** handled by the interface;
    

**Company map** - Map Company Code sent by the interface with existing Clock PMS+ company and define how such bookings should be treated. You can create new companies by going to Company > New Company

**Charge template map** - You can map the Service Inventory Code which you add to the booking (when extra services are selected) with the existing charge templates form Clock PMS+. You can create more charge templates by going to the All settings > Charge templates.

**Please make sure all features are working as designed, all messages are properly handled without producing any errors and the data is exchanging without any problems by performing In-house testing.**

**You may refer to the** [certification test scenarios](https://api-docs.clock-software.com/#50355b43-92f5-4860-b3a0-009bc5f214ac) **to prepare for certification.**
